The First Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine informed the delegation of Great Britain about the situation at the front, potential threats and the needs of the Ukrainian army. -I am grateful to Great Britain for its strong support in the struggle for the survival of the Ukrainian nation. The situation on the front line requires strengthening the capabilities of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. The expansion of military-technical cooperation between the countries will give a new impetus, activate the defense production of both countries,- Lieutenant General Ivan Gavryliuk emphasized. According to him, new technologies and new investments are new opportunities for strengthening Ukraine's defense potential in the tough fight against the aggressor. The parties discussed the signing of contracts in the context of the implementation of projects within the framework of the Framework Agreement between the Government of Ukraine and the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland regarding official credit support for the development of Ukraine's defense capabilities. The British side proposed several projects to meet Ukraine's needs in missile weapons and air defense systems. In particular, it was about the possibility of using revenues from frozen Russian assets for the purchase of British-made missiles. Task Force Kindred is determining what weapons the UK can send to Ukraine from its existing stockpiles. The HIRST Task Force is an intergovernmental group from the UK that aims to stimulate UK industrial production and international cooperation in support of Ukraine, including cooperation with Ukrainian companies. As reported by ArmyInform, Great Britain will provide a loan of 2 billion pounds for the defense of Ukraine. On behalf of the governments of Ukraine and Great Britain <a href=-https://armyinform.com.ua/2024/07/19/velyka-brytaniya-dast-v-kredyt-2-mlrd-funtiv-na-oboronu-ukrayiny/ The loan agreement was signed by Defense Ministers Rustem Umyerov and John Gilley.

Title: Advancing at the front is costing Russia heavy losses — NATO Secretary General
Description: NATO Secretary General announced about this Mark Rutte following the results of the two-day ministerial meeting in Brussels. -Ukraine faces continuous shelling of civilian areas and critical infrastructure facilities. And Russia is making progress at the front, albeit at a high cost. This winter may be the hardest for Ukraine since 2022,- said Mark Rutte. He said the alliance members discussed what they could do to secure critical munitions and air defenses as Russia ramps up its attacks and uses the help of North Korean troops and weapons. In addition, the members of the Alliance are working to fulfill the financial commitment to provide Ukraine with security assistance in the amount of 40 billion euros by the end of 2024. -And I expect the new command in Wiesbaden, the NATO Security Assistance and Training Command for Ukraine, to be fully operational by the end of this year. But we must do more than just support Ukraine in the struggle. We must provide sufficient support to change the trajectory of this conflict once and for all,- emphasized Mark Rutte. The day before Mark Rutte emphasized the need to strengthen Ukraine's air defense with on the part of the partners.

Title: A drone hit a car in Kupyansk: a man was injured
Description: This was reported by the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office. As a result of the impact, the 65-year-old driver was injured. According to preliminary data, the Russian army used the Molniya attack UAV. Under the procedural guidance of the Kupyan District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, a pre-trial investigation into the fact of a war crime has been initiated (Part 1 of Article 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). Despite the difficult security situation, prosecutors, together with police investigators, are taking all measures to document crimes committed by servicemen of the Soviet Union. As reported by ArmyInform, on the morning of December 4, the Russians dropped on the city Kostyantynivka's two guided aerial bombs. Three men were slightly injured.

Title: Rustem Umyerov: A new full-time position will appear in each brigade of the Armed Forces
Description: He wrote about this on December 4 in social networks. -We are reforming the procurement system, so that the army quickly and efficiently receives everything necessary for the defense of the country,- Rustem Umyerov said. According to him, these specialists will be responsible for procurement planning and organization, preparation of tender documents, market analysis, search for suppliers, selection and evaluation of offers. -Thanks to this, procurement for our units will be carried out quickly, transparently and taking into account the real needs of soldiers. A separate task is to eliminate conflicts of interest. The new position will make it possible to distinguish between the combat duties of the military and tasks related to procurement,- the Minister of Defense assured. He emphasized that the main goal is for Ukrainian soldiers to receive all the necessary means to repel Russian aggression in a timely manner. -We are continuing systemic changes to strengthen the defense capability and increase the efficiency of the Armed Forces,- the head of the defense department summarized. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov during a report to the President presented the concept of creating a military ombudsman institution. This is an initiative of the Ministry of Defense aimed at systematically protecting the rights of servicemen, reservists and their families.

Title: Rustem Umyerov: A new full-time position will appear in each brigade of the Armed Forces
Description: He wrote about this on December 4 in social networks. -We are reforming the procurement system, so that the army quickly and efficiently receives everything necessary for the defense of the country,- Rustem Umyerov said. According to him, these specialists will be responsible for procurement planning and organization, preparation of tender documents, market analysis, search for suppliers, selection and evaluation of offers. -Thanks to this, procurement for our units will be carried out quickly, transparently and taking into account the real needs of soldiers. A separate task is to eliminate conflicts of interest. The new position will make it possible to distinguish between the combat duties of the military and tasks related to procurement,- the Minister of Defense assured. He emphasized that the main goal is for Ukrainian soldiers to receive all the necessary means to repel Russian aggression in a timely manner. -We are continuing systemic changes to strengthen the defense capability and increase the efficiency of the Armed Forces,- the head of the defense department summarized. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov during a report to the President presented the concept of creating a military ombudsman institution. This is an initiative of the Ministry of Defense aimed at systematically protecting the rights of servicemen, reservists and their families.

Title: Oleksandr Syrsky defined the task of stabilizing the situation in threatening directions
Description: This is stated in a message on the page on Facebook. -I listened to the officials in the areas of activity. The main attention was paid to measures to create stable defense, management of subordinate units, organization of combat and work of headquarters, ensuring reliable functioning of the management system of the Armed Forces and the Defense Forces as a whole,- said Oleksandr Syrskyi. Based on the results of the event, the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine identified specific tasks to stabilize the situation in threatening areas, increase the combat capabilities of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, in particular, the continuation of the creation of relevant reserves. Oleksandr Syrskyi emphasized the importance of high-quality training of personnel and their timely replenishment of combat military units and units. -He emphasized that preserving the lives and health of servicemen is a priority. In this context, in addition to high-quality training of soldiers, we need to master, implement and scale innovations and military technologies as soon as possible. The Armed Forces of Ukraine must be one step ahead of the enemy,- emphasized the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, during the past day took place 192 combat clashes. The enemy concentrated its main efforts on the Pokrovsky and Kurakhiv directions.

Title: At least three people were injured as a result of the attack on Kostyantynivka
Description: This was reported by the head of Donetsk OVA Vadym Filashkin. The airstrike damaged four high-rise buildings, four businesses, three power lines and a gas pipeline. As reported, on the afternoon of December 3, the Russian occupying forces launched an artillery attack on the town of Kostiantynivka. The shells hit between an apartment building and a kindergarten. As the local residents said, at that time a taxi arrived in the courtyard of the house, in which two passengers got on. As a result of the explosion, a taxi driver was killed, and three local residents were injured. Read more in the ArmyInform report from the scene.

Title: Relay cabinets of Ukrzaliznytsia were set on fire: 6 citizens were notified of the suspicion
Description: This was notified in the SBU. At the enemy's behest, they tried to destroy substations and energy facilities of Ukrzaliznytsia with the help of flammable mixtures. The occupiers recruited all the participants remotely through specially created Telegram channels, where the rioters offer money in exchange for cooperation. However, instead of funds from the Russians, the arsonists received suspicion from Ukrainian law enforcement officers. Thus, a 33-year-old resident of the capital was detained in the Kyiv region, who, after serving 10 years in prison for theft, went to cooperate with the occupiers. According to their instructions, the recidivist set fire to the Ukrzaliznytsia relay box, which ensures the uninterrupted movement of trains on one of the sections in Kyiv. Another person involved is a 29-year-old resident of Boryspil, a gambling addict who hoped to -cover- his losses on lottery machines with money from the Russian Federation. For this purpose, the intruder also burned down another Ukrzaliznytsia relay cabinet. Four local teenagers, aged 15 and 14, were arrested in Mykolaiv Oblast for setting fire to an electrical substation that provides electricity to most of the residents of Pervomaysky District. During the searches, clothes, flammable mixtures and mobile phones with evidence of crimes were seized from the suspects. All detainees were notified of the suspicion under part. 2 Art. 113 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (sabotage committed under martial law). Perpetrators, including minors, face life imprisonment with confiscation of property. Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in Kyiv and Kyiv, Mykolaiv Oblasts jointly with the National Police under the procedural guidance of the Kyiv City Prosecutor's Office, as well as the Kyiv and Mykolaiv Oblast Prosecutor's Offices.

Title: -Most of those who surrender are newly mobilized-: the enemy throws reserves into the assaults
Description: The spokesman of the operational and strategic group of troops -Khortytsia- lieutenant colonel Nazar Voloshyn. In particular, according to Nazar Voloshyn, it was hot in the Kurakhiv direction. There, the occupiers tried to break through the Ukrainian defense 44 times last day. Assaults cost the enemy huge losses. In addition, over the past 10 days, approximately 50 occupiers have surrendered. -Most of those who surrender are newly mobilized and recently convicted. There are rare cases when those who are now captured have less than a month from the announcement of the verdict to their capture,- Nazar Voloshyn noted. As reported ArmyInform, only in the last week the losses of the occupiers on the Eastern Front amounted to almost 9 thousand persons

Title: He ran away with his -wife- to live with his bride: two pseudo-spouses were exposed at the border
Description: About the State Border Service of Ukraine informs December 4. -At the Krakivets checkpoint, the border guards of the Lviv detachment discovered a 24-year-old man and a 23-year-old woman who got married, most likely, without the intention of creating a real family,- the message reads. At first, the husband said that he was allegedly taking his wife to Germany for treatment of the musculoskeletal system. Later it turned out that he had recently proposed to another girl, who, after crossing the border, was supposed to go to him. In addition, border guards exposed another pseudo-couple at the Sheghina checkpoint. -A 44-year-old native of Ivano-Frankivsk region married a 57-year-old compatriot. In communication with the border guards, the man could not answer a number of questions: where his wife is from and when she was born, he also could not say. The citizen intended to leave for the Czech Republic,- said the State Security Service. On the detection of signs of a criminal offense, responsibility for which is provided for in Art. 332 of the Criminal Code -Illegal transportation of persons across the state border of Ukraine-, operatives of the detachment informed the National Police. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: Neither the dropping of enemy drones nor fear prevented the Reaper from evacuating his wounded comra...
Description: His story was told in the Land Forces. -Reaper- was on combat duty that day. One of the pilots was injured by the recoil, but it was not possible to evacuate him through open terrain. Brothers called Oleg for help as a more experienced fighter. Despite the danger from repeated drops, -Reaper- reached the wounded man and helped save him. -Put on the armor and ran. I worked in that place and knew where he could be dragged. At that moment, it was not scary, I did not think whether they would reset or not. Fear came later. And then we waited for the moment and pulled away together with a friend,- the fighter said. The Ground Forces said that before the war, -Zhnets- was a tractor driver. He joined the army on mobilization. -It was clear to me that it was better to stop the enemies away from home. When the enemy is next to your family, it is more difficult to fight - your head is occupied by something else,- Oleg explains his motivation. As reported by ArmyInform, Oleksiy on the pseudo -Loki- in October 2024 in the north -operatora-pzrk-loki/->knocked down from MANPADS two enemy UAVs of the type Shahed-131/136. He only had 15 minutes to do it.

Title: A house caught fire in Vinnytsia due to the fall of a Russian drone
Description: informs about this by the State Emergency Service of Ukraine. As noted, five residents of the building were not injured. The building was partially destroyed, but the fire was quickly extinguished thanks to the efforts of rescuers. As reported by ArmiyaInform, as of the morning of December 4, Russian troops continue to strike the populated areas of Donetsk region. During the day, 20 shellings were recorded, which caused significant destruction and loss of life.

Title: -Maidan- in Georgia and an offensive operation in Syria: Putin is losing influence in the Caucasus a...
Description: Meanwhile, on November 27, Syrian opposition forces launched a large-scale offensive against Bashar al-Assad's forces in Aleppo province in Syria. The Syrian rebels successfully took advantage of the vacuum created by the weakening of Hezbollah, pressure on Iran and Russia's focus on the war with Ukraine. It was the Russians who most helped Assad stay in power since the start of the country's civil war in 2011. Oleksandr Chupak, an expert of the non-governmental analytical center -Ukrainian Studies of Strategic Studies-, talks about the situation in Georgia and Syria in an exclusive comment to ArmyInform. -Anti-government protests in Georgia cannot but remind us of the events of the Revolution of Dignity in Ukraine in 2013-2014. Pro-Russian oligarchic forces likely hold power through manipulation of the electoral process. The government announces the suspension of the European integration process. Thousands of protests erupt on the streets, which are accompanied by clashes between demonstrators and security forces. Like Yanukovych's regime at the beginning of the protests in Kyiv, the Georgian government exudes confidence that the rallies will lead to nothing. Despite national dissatisfaction with the announced results of the elections held on October 26, Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze was not afraid to put the country's rapprochement with the EU on hold on November 28. The move was immediately hailed by Vladimir Putin as an example of -courage-. As soon as the protests broke out, the authorities began to frighten the nation with the so-called -Ukrainian scenario.- The most powerful Georgian oligarch, Bidzina Ivanishvili, who is credited with full control over the current government, has warned of the danger of a second Russian invasion in the event of an overthrow. Despite the mass of the protests, they lack a clear leader. President Salome Zurabishvili, who did not recognize the election results and publicly supported the protesters, is symbolically acting in this role. However, it is not directly coordinating the protestors' efforts. The difference here can be costly, because on the other side of the confrontation, the security forces have not yet shown any signs of disloyalty to the authorities. The lack of a general plan of action does not allow Georgians to organize resistance cells outside the borders of large cities. The government firmly controls the state media, which carries out anti-protest propaganda. Further developments will depend on the ability of various protest groups to unite around a common goal. Having a strong leader or group of leaders with uncompromising views can turn a national movement into a force that the authorities cannot handle. However, the probability of success of anti-government forces in Georgia is still much lower than a decade ago in Ukraine.- -The offensive of the Syrian opposition groups in the north-east of the country is already being compared with the attack of Hamas on Israel last October. Both operations were unexpected by their opponents and brought quick results to the attackers. However, in the case of Syria, the current government is on the verge of a real disaster. In fact, the province of Aleppo was surrendered without a fight, for which complex battles with the involvement of foreign contingents (primarily Russian and Iranian) were fought for years. As of December 4, fighting is underway for the city of Hama, an important logistics center in the center of the country that connects the north (Aleppo), the south (Damascus) and the Mediterranean coast, where the Russian naval contingent is located. Since the rapid advance of the opposition forces has stopped, the front line is relatively stabilized. They name several scenarios for the further development of events, but for Ukraine, the best option would be the intensification of hostilities for a long time, which would force Russia to transfer significant forces to Syria. Currently, we see that the Syrian government army is showing low combat effectiveness, so Assad will rely on the support of his partners. There are already two positive points for us: — the transfer of Russian aircraft to Syria. This can reduce the intensity of shelling of the Russian-Ukrainian front by air defense systems and air defense systems and the general activity of enemy aviation; — increasing costs for the war in Syria will divert Russian forces from the Ukrainian direction and may accelerate the economic collapse of Moscow. Further developments will depend on the presence of forces in the opposition. Obviously, their rapid offensive would not have been possible without the foreign support that Turkey, the United States and Europe could provide. If the supply rate is high (and not the same as for Ukraine), opposition forces will be able to gain a foothold and develop an offensive. The fate of the Russian fleet is the most interesting. Where will he go if the government loses the coast? If Spain does not allow through Gibraltar, there remains a passage through the Bosphorus, if the Turks allow it. Then an exciting trip to Novorossiysk awaits on the ship of the Russian Federation under the strikes of Ukrainian surface drones.-

Title: -One or two reach the trenches, where they are destroyed by infantry or drones-: near Toretsk, the e...
Description: Yevhen Alkhimov, press officer of 28 of a separate mechanized brigade named after the Knights of the Winter Campaign. According to Yevhen Alkhimov, the stormtroopers are supported by artillery and drones. Often before attacks, smoke is thrown onto the field so that under their cover the stormtroopers can advance as far as possible, but it does not always work out. -Our line is quite stable in the brigade. Sometimes it happens that one or two get to our trenches, but they are either destroyed there by the infantry, or the drones finish them off,- says Yevnen Alkhimov. Previously ArmyInform reported that in the city of Toretsk, a week of urban battles has eliminated up to half a thousand people in the Russian occupation army.

Title: The occupiers intensified shelling of Donetsk region: more than 700 people were evacuated
Description: reported this by the head of Donetsk OVA Vadym Filashkin. Pokrovsky district: Kramatorskyi district: Bakhmutskyi district: 704 people, including 18 children, were evacuated from the front line. Authorities continue to provide aid to victims and work to restore critical infrastructure. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy several times targeted residential neighborhoods of the city of Pokrovsk Donetsk region.

Title: She spied on the defenders of Chernihiv under the guise of taxi rides: a minor was detained
Description: About informs December 4 SBU. -In order to -bypass- the Ukrainian air defense, the agent had to identify and transmit to the aggressor the coordinates of the anti-aircraft missile systems and radar stations of the Armed Forces of Ukraine that defend the border region. For the conspiracy of reconnaissance trips, the girl ordered a taxi in which she drove around the area and secretly recorded the objects she needed,- the SBU said. After such trips, the figure returned home, where she created an intelligence report for her Russian curator in the form of media files with -required- geolocations. The SBU military counterintelligence exposed a Russian agent, documented her crimes and arrested her -red handed- while she was photographing a defense facility. It was established that the person involved was in direct contact with a staff member of the Russian game, with whom she communicated through an anonymous chat in the messenger. During the searches, a mobile phone with evidence of intelligence and subversive activities for the benefit of the Russian Federation was seized from the detainee. On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service informed the accused about suspicion for h. 2 Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (treason committed under martial law). The perpetrator is in custody. She faces up to life in prison with forfeiture of property. As reported by ArmyInform, the Security Service detained</a a resident of the city of Kostyantynivka, who was recruited by the special service of the Russian Federation in the summer of this year.

Title: Ukrainian missile program: why -Neptune- and -Palyanytsia- are becoming symbols of a new defense era
Description: This was announced by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov. According to him, April 13, 2022 was a historic day for Ukrainian defense. Just then, using the domestic missile complex -Neptun-, the Armed Forces of Ukraine sank the flagship of the Black Sea Fleet of the Russian Federation - the cruiser -Moscow-. -Today, when the war continues, missiles become not only a symbol of a technological breakthrough, but also a critically important tool for the defense of our state,- he noted. The Minister of Defense said that in modern warfare, missiles are a key element for striking the deep rear of the enemy. Despite the effectiveness of drones, their power is limited. In addition, the use of foreign missiles often requires coordination with partners. -This is where the strategic importance of own missiles is manifested. Ukrainian cruise and ballistic missiles will allow our Armed Forces to act independently, delivering pinpoint strikes on key enemy targets. This not only strengthens our defense, but also creates an effective deterrent mechanism for the aggressor,- he assured. Rustem Umyerov reminded that this year Ukraine has already produced the first 100 rockets a>. This became possible thanks to the work of the Ministry of Defense, which coordinates both public and private initiatives in missile development. -In particular, serial production of R-360 cruise missiles of the Neptune complex has been restored and scaled up. Modified missiles are now capable of hitting targets at a longer range. Private enterprises are also showing incredible results,- he said. For example, a new startup implemented the Palyanitsa missile project, which has already entered serial production thanks to the support of the Ministry of Defense. -This is a vivid example of how the state and the private sector come together to achieve a common goal,- said the head of the defense department. As Rustem Umyerov noted, Ukraine is not only developing its own potential, but also integrating into the European defense industry. This cooperation makes it possible to localize the production of foreign technologies in Ukraine. Among the key projects: According to the Minister of Defense, these initiatives provide access to advanced developments and create an opportunity for the modernization of the Ukrainian defense industry. The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine is actively accelerating structural changes, creating conditions for more effective management of the missile program. The new Department of Support for Missile Projects and ABM Means, as well as the Main Directorate for the Development of Missile Programs, will coordinate the efforts of the state and the private sector. -This program will allow not only to provide modern weapons for today's battles, but also to lay the foundation for the defense of the future. Ukrainian missiles will become a guarantor of the security of our state, capable of deterring any aggression,- Rustem Umyerov explained. He emphasized that the Ukrainian missile program is not only about war. It's about independence, self-sufficiency and technological breakthrough. -Our successes in rocketry prove that we are capable of creating game-changing weapons. These missiles will protect our land today. And they will ensure peace in the future. Because in the modern world, victory is not only a question of strength, but also a question of technology,- he summarized. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov held a meeting with Ukrainian manufacturers of missile weapons, at which plans for 2025, key areas of cooperation and development of the industry were discussed.

Title: Mastery and precision: the President noted the contribution of artillerymen to the defense of Ukrain...
Description: He wrote about this in his Telegram channel. -The skill of our gunners and the accuracy of our rocket launchers significantly reduce the Russian military potential and help all units of the Defense and Security Forces of Ukraine to carry out combat tasks,- the head of state emphasized in his address. He thanked every soldier, sergeant and officer serving in the missile and artillery units for their professionalism and dedication. -Thank you for the fact that Ukraine has such an effective force!- Volodymyr Zelenskyi concluded. Missile Troops and Artillery Day is celebrated as a recognition of the important role of these units in ensuring the country's defense capability and maintaining its sovereignty. As reported by ArmyInform, The Minister of Defense thanked the soldiers of the missile forces and artillery.

Title: -Like the Vietnam War-: the occupiers understand that if they dig, they will run out very quickly
Description: Oleksandr Borodin, spokesman for the Third assault brigade. According to him, the Russians are constantly digging various holes, fox hides and vines between the trenches. -That's why storming such places is difficult. Similar to the experience of the Vietnam War. It is very difficult to clean them at all. Because you don't understand, it can be a deepening, or it can be 10 meters,- said Oleksandr Borodin. As reported ArmyInform, the operative task of the occupiers in Kharkiv Oblast is to cross the Oskil River, however they do not have any significant successes.

Title: Severodonetsk freezes, young people are sent to the front: the realities of the occupied Luhansk reg...
Description: This was reported by Artem Lysohor, head of the Luhansk OVA. Changes to Russian legislation allow recruits to be sent to a combat zone immediately after being drafted, without the mandatory three-month term of military service. In Severodonetsk, meanwhile, the third winter continues without full-fledged centralized heating. The occupation authorities were unable to fulfill their promises regarding heat supply made in 2023-2024. Despite the launch of one boiler house, its capacity is not enough to heat multi-storey residential areas. In some neighborhoods, the coolant does not reach at all, and in areas with heating, the batteries remain barely warm. Frequent bursts of pipelines complicate the situation, and the number of emergency teams is insufficient for a quick response. As a result, many local residents remain in the cold without receiving adequate assistance. The freezing residents of Severodonetsk are forced to rely on their own strength in conditions where the occupation authorities continue to ignore their needs. As reported by ArmyInform, there is still no mobile phone in Lysychansk connection, which was disconnected by the Russian occupiers. Local residents are forced to travel to Novoaidar or Starobilsk to contact their relatives.

Title: The North Koreans are not done, but the Russians will replenish their ranks with two more brigades f...
Description: About informsMain Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine on December 4. -To solve the problem with hungry North Koreans, Russia sent Major General Mevlyutov, the deputy commander for resource provision of the Leningrad Military District, to the Kursk fields,- the report says. On the spot, the Russian general ordered to issue individual rations from the food reserves of the 11th separate airborne assault brigade of the Russian Armed Forces to the servicemen of the DPRK army. The GUR reported that the aggressor state Russia continues the process of deploying the North Korean contingent. -Military personnel from the 92nd and 94th special forces brigades of the North Korean army are transferred to the operational subordination of the units of the Russian army participating in the hostilities in Kurshchyna, in particular, the 22nd motorized rifle regiment, the 810th separate marine infantry brigade and the above-mentioned 11th infantry brigade,- the intelligence officers noted. As reported by ArmyInform, the combat capability of the Koreans in the Kursk region is in question - could the problem be systematic -supplies- of the North Korean contingent.

Title: A sharp increase in the number of enemy drones was recorded in Luhansk region
Description: This was reported by Artem Lysohor, head of the Luhansk OVA. The enemy's artillery activity remained at the same level: 13 shots were fired from barrel artillery, as well as a strike from a rocket salvo fire system was recorded. The enemy also launched an air strike. The main areas of attack were the areas near Stelmakhivka, Novoyehorivka and Grekivka, where the invaders continue to put pressure on Ukrainian defensive positions. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy tried to break through our defense 44 times in the Kurakhiv direction and 44 times - in Pokrovsk.

Title: The defense forces made three strikes on areas where the occupiers were concentrated
Description: This is reported in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 8 :00 December 4. According to the available information, yesterday the enemy launched one missile strike against the positions of Ukrainian units and populated areas with the use of one missile, as well as 64 airstrikes, dropping 84 guided aerial bombs. -In addition, the enemy launched about 4,900 attacks, of which 172 were from rocket salvo systems, and used 2,119 kamikaze drones for damage,- the report said. The enemy also carried out airstrikes, in particular in the areas of Odnorobivka, Visoka Yaruga, Hlyboke, Hlushkivka, Ivanivka, Kivsharivka, Serebryanka, Bilokuzmynivka, Druzhkivka, Kostiantynivka, Toretsk, Berestok, Petrivka, Pokrovsk, Aleksandro-Kalynovka, Stara Mykolaivka, Mirnograd, Konstantinopolske , Dachne, Ulakli, Dniproenergia and Velika Novosilka. As reported by ArmyInform, last day /->losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 1,670 people. In addition, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed seven tanks, 31 armored combat vehicles, 26 artillery systems, one air defense vehicle, 29 operational-tactical UAVs, 80 vehicles and one unit of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: The Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces repelled the drone attack in nine regions: most of the t...
Description: This was reported by the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As of 9:00 a.m., units of anti-aircraft missile forces, EW and mobile fire groups of the Air Force and Defense Forces of Ukraine shot down 29 enemy UAVs in Kyiv, Kharkiv, Poltava, Sumy, Chernihiv, Khmelnytskyi, Ternopil, Mykolaiv, and Donetsk regions. It is noted that 18 drones were lost in location, 1 left the controlled airspace in the direction of the temporarily occupied territory. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy increased the number of missile carriers in the Black Sea: there is a threat of use of -Calibers-.

Title: The Minister of Defense announced the introduction of the post of military ombudsman
Description: He wrote about this on his Facebook page. The first step in this direction was the creation of the Central Office for the Protection of Servicemen's Rights, which is already showing results: responding to complaints, visiting places of violations, checking and ensuring the restoration of violated rights. The next stage is the introduction of the institution of a military ombudsman, who will receive all the necessary tools to protect the rights of soldiers and solve systemic problems. -The President instructed to prepare a presentation of the draft law, and soon this document will be presented for consideration by the Verkhovna Rada,- Rustem Umyerov noted. The minister emphasized that ensuring justice and support for Ukrainian soldiers is a priority. -A strong army is not only modern equipment, but also people whose rights and needs must be protected,- he added. As ArmiyaInform reported, The Ministry of Defense presented the concept of reform of military medical commissions.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, fortitude, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine , decree: to start a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which should be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: Enemy shelling of Kherson region: the enemy attacked critical infrastructure, damaged 20 buildings
Description: informs the head of Kherson Regional State Oleksandr Prokudin about this. Last day Tomyna Balka, Tyaginka, Mykhailivka, Beryslav, Antonivka, Bilozerka, Komysany, Shiroka Balka, Stanislav, Mykilske, Mylove, Sablukivka, Novoraisk, Novovorontsovka, Odradokamyanka, Zmiivka, Sadove, Prydniprovske and the city of Kherson came under enemy fire and airstrikes. . It is noted that the Russian military attacked critical and social infrastructure. The occupiers also attacked residential quarters of populated areas of the region, in particular damaged 20 private houses and vandalized a cellular tower and a utility building. As reported by ArmyInform, during the day the occupiers also >made 395 strikes on 11 settlements of the Zaporizhzhia region.

Title: The enemy has increased the number of missile carriers in the Black Sea: there is a threat -Calibers...
Description: This was reported by the Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. There are no enemy ships in the Sea of ​​Azov. There are 6 enemy ships in the Mediterranean Sea, 4 of which are carriers of Kalibr cruise missiles with a total salvo of up to 41 missiles. For a day, in the interests of the Russian Federation, passage through the Kerch Strait was carried out: The Russian Federation continues to violate the International Convention for the Protection of Human Life at Sea of ​​1974. (SOLAS) by disabling automatic identification systems. As reported by ArmyInform, during the visit of a delegation of industry representatives of the Kingdom of Denmark to a meeting was held with Ukrainian military sailors and shipbuilding specialists.

Title: The enemy tried to break through our defenses 44 times in the Kurakhiv direction and 44 times in the...
Description: This is reported in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 08 :00 December 4. In the Kharkiv direction the enemy carried out offensive and assault actions six times in the Vovchansk, Hlybokoy districts and in the Kozachai Lopan direction. The number of combat clashes per day in the Kupyan direction reached thirteen. The defense forces repelled the attacks of the occupiers in the districts of Lozova, Stelmakhivka, Kolisnikivka, and Pershotravnevoy. On the Lyman direction, our troops stopped nine enemy attacks. The invaders concentrated their main efforts in the areas of Pershotravneve, Novoehorivka, Grekivka, Yampolivka and Terny settlements. Three Russian attacks repulsed Ukrainian units in the Kramatorsk direction, the enemy tried to advance to Stupochy, Bila Hora and in the area of ​​Chasovoy Yar. In the Toretsk direction the enemy tried to advance three times in the Toretsk and Nelipivka regions. In the Pokrovsky direction our defenders repelled 44 attacks over the past day. The enemy tried to advance in the vicinity of Myrolyubivka, Lysivka, Promeny, Dachenskyi, Chumatskyi and Novopustinka. The defense forces continue to restrain the enemy in the Kurakhiv direction. In the districts of Sontsivka, Zori, Dalniy, Kurakhovo, Elizavetivka, and Hannivka, the occupiers tried to break through Ukrainian defense lines 44 times. In the Vremivsk direction, our defenders stopped 25 enemy attacks in the districts of Kostyantynopolsky, Suhy Yali, Rozdolny, Makarivka, and Novodarivka. In the Orihiv direction, enemy units tried to advance four times in the areas of Robotyny, Novodanilivka, and Novoandriivka. In the Dnieper direction the invaders unsuccessfully attacked the positions of our troops seven times. The Defense Forces of Ukraine continue the operation in the Kursk direction, where the enemy carried out five airstrikes over the past day, using six guided air bombs; Ukrainian defenders also repelled thirty enemy attacks. The operational situation on the Volyn and Poliske directions has not changed significantly. No signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected. On the border with Chernihiv and Sumy regions, the enemy maintains a military presence, conducts reconnaissance and artillery fire. In general, last day losses of the Russian invaders were 1,670 people. In addition, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed seven tanks, 31 armored combat vehicles, 26 artillery systems, one air defense vehicle, 29 operational-tactical UAVs, 80 vehicles and a unit of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: Mykolayiv region under fire: the enemy attacked with FPV drones and artillery, power lines were dama...
Description: informs the head of Mykolaivska OVA Vitaly Kim about this. -Yesterday, December 3, at 9:50 a.m., 3:40 p.m. and 4:15 p.m., the enemy attacked the Kutsurub community with FPV drones. Also, at 14:00, the community came under enemy artillery shelling. As a result of one of the shellings in the village of Ivanivka, a power line was damaged, which has already been restored. There are no casualties,- he said. Also, today, December 4, at 00:20, the water area of ​​Ochakivska community was under enemy mortar fire. There are no casualties. As reported by ArmyInform, on November 29, the Mykolaiv region also attacks with the use of drones, artillery and ballistic missiles.

Title: Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces: Artillery shells are revenge for destroyed cities and tortur...
Description: He wrote about this in his Telegram channel. -Nowadays we have returned to the old traditions. Ukrainian gunners considered St. Barbara their patron saint, believing that she protects against sudden death, and lightning and thunder symbolize the power of artillery,- the general noted. Oleksandr Syrsky emphasized that today it is the rocket launchers and artillerymen who inflict the greatest amount of fire damage on the enemy, accurately hitting the targets and effectively destroying the Russian occupiers. -The shells and rockets hitting the enemy carry the revenge of the entire Ukrainian people for the destroyed cities, for every murdered and tortured Ukrainian, for every child's tear,- he added. The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces also expressed gratitude to the soldiers for their steadfastness and uncompromising struggle and remembered those gunners and rocket launchers who gave their lives for the Independence of Ukraine. -Eternal memory and eternal glory to all fallen heroes! I believe that every shot you make brings us closer to victory!- — stressed Oleksandr Syrskyi. As reported by ArmyInform, The Minister of Defense thanked the soldiers of the missile forces and artillery.

Title: 395 strikes per day: the occupiers attacked 11 populated areas of Zaporizhzhia
Description: This was reported by Ivan Fedorov, the head of Zaporizhzhia OVA. Russian troops carried out 8 air strikes on Gulyaipol. In addition, 214 UAVs of various modifications attacked Bilenka, Lobkovo, Gulyaipole, Shcherbaki, Novoandriivka, Novodanilivka, Mala Tokmachka, Biloghirya, Malinivka, Novodarivka, and Olhivske. As the head of the OVA noted, 8 shellings from the RSZV were carried out on the territory of Novodanilivka, Novoandriivka and Novodarivka. According to Ivan Fedorov, 165 artillery strikes fell on Lobkovo, Gulyaipol, Shcherbaki, Novoandriivka, Novodanilivka, Malia Tokmachka, Biloghirya, Malynivka, Novodarivka, and Olhivka. There were also 4 reports of the destruction of residential buildings and infrastructure facilities. Civilians were not harmed. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy several times targeted residential neighborhoods of the city of Pokrovsk Donetsk region.

Title: The Minister of Defense thanked the soldiers of the missile troops and artillery
Description: He wrote about this in social networks. -Dear soldiers of the missile troops and artillery! Every day you destroy the enemy, hitting targets with jewels, protecting our people and supporting your brothers on the front. Your skill and quick mastery of the most modern weapons have become a powerful -fiery fist- of the Defense Forces, which is highly valued by our allies,- the Minister of Defense emphasized. He wished them strength, health and impeccable accuracy. -Happy Missile Forces and Artillery Day! Glory to Ukraine!- Rustem Umyerov stressed. As reported by ArmyInform, on the eve of the Day of Missile Troops and Artillery of Ukraine, which this year will be celebrated for the first time on December 4, on the day of St. Barbara, the patroness of artillerymen and rocketmen, in Kyiv presented the calendar -Knights of Hellfire.-

Title: More than three dozen BBMs and 1,670 occupants: the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine ann...
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The total combat losses of the enemy from 24.02.22 to 04.12.24 are approximately: As reported by ArmyInform, our soldiers stopped 180 Russian assaults: the enemy concentrated his efforts in two directions.

Title: Our soldiers stopped 180 Russian assaults: the enemy concentrated its efforts in two directions
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In addition, the occupiers are actively attacking in the Vremivsk and Kupyansk directions. The terrorist state carried out 42 airstrikes, dropping 47 anti-aircraft missiles. In addition, the invaders used 650 kamikaze drones for strikes and fired almost 4,000 shots at the positions of our troops and populated areas. In the Kharkiv direction, Russian terrorists unsuccessfully stormed the positions of our units six times in the Vovchansk, Hlyboki districts, and in the Kozachai Lopan direction. according to estimates, the aggressor lost 58 servicemen killed and wounded and two cars destroyed, Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed seven UAVs and damaged a tank, two artillery systems and three enemy vehicles. Sixteen times the enemy attacked our positionson the Kupyansk direction. In the vicinity of Lozova, Stelmakhivka, Kolisnikivka and Pershotravnevo, units of the Defense Forces repulsed ten assaults. Six clashes are ongoing. In the Lyman direction Russian troops attacked Ukrainian defenders nine times in the areas of Pershotravneve, Novoyehorivka, Grekivka, Yampolivka and Terny settlements. Three attacks of the invaders repulsed the Ukrainian units in the Kramatorsk direction, the enemy tried to advance to Stupochky, Bila Hora and in the area of ​​Chasovoy Yar. Enemy aircraft attacked Kostyantynivka. In Toretsk and Nelipivka, the enemy tried three times to improve their position in the Toretsk direction, the attacks were repulsed by the Defense Forces. In the Pokrovsky direction during the day, the aggressor attacked our positions 44 times in Myrolyubivka, Lysivka, Promenya, Dachenskyi, Chumatskyi and Novopustinka districts. Six clashes are still ongoing. according to estimates, the occupiers lost 395 servicemen killed and wounded in this direction. Our soldiers destroyed seven armored combat vehicles, two artillery systems, three motorcycles and a unit of the occupier's motor vehicles. Ukrainian defenders also caused significant damage to an armored combat vehicle, an artillery system, and an enemy tank. 38 enemy attacks were recorded in the Kurakhiv direction. Four of them are ongoing. Mainly, fighting continues in Sontsivka, Zori, Dalniy, Kurakhovo, Elizavetivka and Hannivka districts. Twenty-three times the enemy stormed the front edge of our defense in the regions of Kostiantynopolskyi, Suhy Yali, Rozdolnyi, Makarivka and Novodarivka in the Vremivsk direction, six skirmishes continue. The enemy launched four attacks in the districts of Robotyny, Novodanilivka and Novoandriivka in the Orichivsk direction, all attacks were repelled by our defenders. Five times, the enemy unsuccessfully tried to attack the positions of the Ukrainian defenders on the Dnieper direction. The Defense Forces of Ukraine continue the operation in Kurshchyna, where our troops repelled 20 enemy attacks, six more combat clashes are ongoing. Soldiers of the 42nd Separate Mechanized Brigade, the 68th Separate Yeger Brigade named after Oleksa Dovbush and the 48th Separate Assault Battalion named after Noman Chelebidzhikhan were recognized for effective combat work in the department, who confidently hold the lines and inflict significant losses on the enemy. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the -Cats- unit of the reconnaissance platoon of the 130th battalion of the Territorial Defense Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces nashi-vidbyly-zavdyaky-unikalnym-dronam/->showed their work with drones during a powerful assault on the village Maksimivka is south of Kurakhovo.

Title: CAESAR doctors: how French self-propelled guns are repaired near the front line. ArmyInform report
Description: Proximity to the front is not just words or geography, it is immediately felt: while we were waiting for the boys, we saw about ten flights from different directions. Only by the smoke rising, it was roughly understood whether it was an anti-tank missile or an anti-aircraft missile. White and focused is the KAB, and black and floating on the horizon is the MLRS. The guys have arrived and we are quickly going to the landing site, one of thousands in Donetsk region. Not the only place where you can try to hide in the steppe. Almost every landing is cut down, injured by enemy artillery or anti-aircraft guns, but saved for our defenders. We've arrived at the Burrow, the camouflaged hideout for the CAESAR ACS and its crew. The machine lives up to its name, the CAESAR is big and majestic. It would be a virtue on parade, but in the steppe it is not easy to hide it to protect it from enemy blows. Driver-mechanics Serhii and Ivan greet the cannon, they are old friends and brothers, and like real doctors, they take suitcases with tools and immediately start inspecting the car. Ivan disappears behind a huge wheel, everyone is anxiously waiting for a diagnosis: whether it will be possible to repair it on the spot, or whether it will have to be taken deeper to the rear, to the repair company. An anxious wait, finally Ivan says that today's problem is small: the tube on the handbrake is broken. Everyone breathes a sigh of relief. From time to time, Ivan's smiling face appears from under CAESAR, a headlamp shines, and Serhii hands out tools, gives advice and cheers everyone up with jokes. Then they conjure something together with the help of a gas burner and tweezers, Ivan disappears again. In 15-20 minutes, satisfied with their work, they say that the car is ready for battle. The calculation quickly gathers and goes on combat duty, leaving the smoke behind, and we behind them, only already in the direction of the contact line. Serhiy is a driver-mechanic. He is 50 years old, he is from the Chernihiv region, he was mobilized back in 2022, he got into the repair department of the brigade. I ask how CAESAR is in terms of repairs. Sergey smiles and shakes his head: - CAESAR seems not adapted to these weather conditions and operating conditions. It's one thing to ride the track, shoot and drive, then it's all good. And when bad weather starts, and you have to drive through fields, then everything becomes much more difficult. On the Zaporizhzhia direction, there was a difficult situation with the brake pipes, because when the mud freezes, it easily breaks the brake lines. We then went around the clock to repair. Because this is a very smart car, all on sensors, and if it shows that the brake fluid is leaking, then the car will not go anywhere. And so we moved twenty-four hours a day from car to car, repairing. Unfortunately, this is a weak point, because the car is like a military one, and the pipelines are made of plastic tubes that cannot withstand any loads. - Perhaps the French created this self-propelled gun for desert conditions? - Most likely, for European conditions. Because we faced the fact that in the summer, when there was no rain and the dust was terrible, then everything also went out of order. For example, the locks on the wedge could not be closed, because the guys try to lubricate everything, but dust gets stuck, and this does not allow the machine to work as it should. The responsibilities of the calculation include the maintenance of a combat vehicle. There are things they have to do after combat work, including cleaning the wedge. Because if it is dirty, the lock does not close, then they cannot shoot, the automation simply will not allow it. If the calculation is not yet very experienced, then it happens that they call - and we repair the car by phone, remotely. - Do you have time for departures? - We try. It happens when you work on one machine, you know that two more machines are waiting for you, then you choose something more difficult that the guys themselves will not be able to eliminate. There are still problems with the electronics. Unfortunately, the further, the more. Because even the powder boxes fall apart from so many shots. Can you imagine what happens to those wires and sensors in the car that they endure? - Do you have enough spare parts? - There are enough critical ones, they are supplied to us. We buy some small things ourselves, because there is no time to wait for elementary things, such as oil seals, gaskets. When there is already a serious breakdown, then the car goes to the factory, and there they already change the parts. —You started with the Soviet self-propelled guns. How different is CAESAR from them? - Very different, especially the -stuffing-. Because CAESAR is packed with electronics. In the Soviet self-propelled guns, everything is arranged more simply: it drives - while it drives, it shoots - while it can shoot. And there are many such nuances that some sensor has worked - and the car has stopped. Like today, when the usual brake pipe broke. It's good that the car was in the hole. And it happens that it is on the way to the fire line, much closer to the front line, and then it is an excellent target for FPV drones, which take apart the car very quickly. There was no such thing in the Zaporizhzhia direction, we did not hear about efpivishkas, except that -Lancets- flew in from time to time. Driver-mechanic Ivan from Vinnytsia region. He was mobilized a year and a half ago. Before mobilization, he worked in the State Emergency Service, was a dispatcher, then resigned, worked abroad, then in construction. — When I was mobilized, I did not have much experience in repairs. Well, except that he was fixing his car at home. Of course, I had no idea about CAESAR then. I saw him for the first time in the Zaporozhye direction and was a little scared at first. But nothing. Day by day sorted it out fine. — Did it take a lot of time? — It takes two or three weeks not to be afraid to approach her. During this time, you can more or less figure out what and why. I was lucky, because as soon as I arrived, I was assigned to work with an already experienced master. And I rode with him for two weeks. He showed me everything, told me everything. I quickly absorbed all this. Here the problem is that YouTube will not help. Almost everything is there, but about CAESAR - nothing. In general. Therefore, only my own experience and the experience of my peers. - Do you remember any such breakdown, which would be called the most difficult? - There were many such breakdowns, you can't remember everything at once. For example, when there was a CAESAR flight that was standing in a hole. It was necessary to quickly evacuate the car from there. We arrived, and everything was cut down. It was necessary to replace the damaged wheels, and try to do this if the nuts were cut by debris! Thank God that not all eight wheels had to be changed, but only on one side and only three. But they are big and heavy. Well, even though the crew helped, because my partner and I arrived, we both take turns. And there was another problem, that it was not land, but a real swamp. We try to lift the car with a jack, and the jack just sinks into the ground. You are constantly lifting, the jack is drowning, you are laying and laying, twisting further. It's as if there is such a thing as changing the wheels, and it took four hours. And it's not in the rear four hours, but where it can fly! And it is there for a very long time. - Do you like this job? - But how can you tell. Unfortunately, this is war. But yes, it's okay. Well, if you know your job, you like it. If there is an order to be transferred somewhere, I will not argue, but if I were given a choice, I would probably go to the CAESAR calculation, and I would try myself there. But that's also normal. Extreme is also enough.

Title: Benefits for combatants: ArmyInform reminds you of the main ones
Description: A significant part of them really works, although it requires a certain amount of time and nerves to design. And some of them have already lost their relevance. Most of the benefits are regulated by the Law of Ukraine -On the Status of War Veterans, Guarantees of Their Social Protection-. Participants in hostilities (hereinafter referred to as UBD) have the right to: The area of ​​housing for which a discount is granted, when calculating the heating fee, is 21 square meters. m of heating area for each person who permanently lives in a residential building and an additional 10.5 sq. m per family. And for families consisting only of disabled persons, a 75% discount is provided for the use of gas for home heating for double the size of the standard heating area (42 sq. m for each person who is entitled to a fee discount, and 21 square meters per family). By the way, you can get a benefit not only for own housing, but also for rented housing. An experimental project was also introduced, which has to make it easier for combatants and war veterans to receive benefits for paying for housing and communal services. As for travel, it is enough to show the ID card of a participant in hostilities for urban transport. For the most part, this works fine with public transport. But there are problems with FOPs. The fact is that local budgets should compensate them for the transportation of beneficiaries. But this does not always happen. So there are cases when the passage is refused. What to do in such a situation, read in our material /a>. To travel to other regions, for example, by train, you also need a ticket sheet, which is given together with the UBD certificate. The state provides combatants with targeted support for obtaining professional (vocational and technical), professional pre-higher and higher education in state and communal educational institutions: Benefits enjoyed by families of combatants: Of course, this is not a complete list of benefits regulated by the state. But we tried to talk about those that are currently relevant. We also note that having the right to a benefit is not always enough to use it. In many cases, it still needs to be properly completed. How to do this, read here. It is also important to understand that there are currently many initiatives by local authorities or private organizations regarding combatants. There are stores that provide discounts on goods and services for the presence of an ID or even a military ticket. Participants in hostilities in many regions can visit museums, exhibitions, zoos, theaters for free or at a significant discount. Therefore, if you are on vacation, you should always have your ID with you. Certain benefits are introduced by local authorities. For example, in Kyiv and some other regions, children of combatants are provided free meals in educational institutions. Or free parking . There are also material assistance programs for military personnel. Therefore, it is worth contacting the authorities at your place of residence and finding out what options are available to you.

Title: The hype surrounding Putin's Oreshnik: the Russian Federation invested considerable funds in the pro...
Description: The direct threats of the bunker fuhrer are joined by Kremlin propagandists, who reproduce many different types of materials, trying to cause panic among Ukrainians. A large number of leaked materials indicate that Russia has invested heavily in a propaganda campaign aimed at promoting its -latest weapon-. However, their reliability raises serious doubts. First, according to the GUR of the IOU, on November 21, Russia struck the territory of Ukraine, using a ballistic missile from the -Kedr- missile complex. Ukrainian air defense can theoretically shoot down such missiles, as well as -Daggers-, about the impossibility of shooting down, which Putin said shortly before the large-scale invasion. Secondly, no confirmation of the -terrible- consequences of the missile strike on the Dnipro was ever provided. Those shots that spread on the network turned out to be an abandoned building in Chita, the St. Petersburg sports and concert complex and the Baikonur Cosmodrome. And the video of the alleged flight of the -Oreshnik- is a plume of exhaust gases from the Soyuz-2.1A space launch vehicle. In fact, Putin's -Oreshnik- turned out to be one big fake, and the hype surrounding it, which alarmed many Ukrainians, has the main purpose of cheering up the domestic Russian audience, frightened by the strikes of Western weapons on Russian military factories, airfields and oil depots. After all, the Armed Forces of Ukraine have repeatedly proven that Russian military facilities are not that protected.

Title: To shoot down a cruise missile or -Shahed- from MANPADS: all about the simulator on which anti-aircr...
Description: At one time, ArmyInform already wrote about the training of anti-aircraft fighters. At that time, the simulator had various aerial targets in its library: airplanes and helicopters of various types. Now, in the conditions of the Russians' use of missiles and UAVs of various types, there is a need for its improvement. As project manager Reserve Lieutenant Colonel Mykola Salamakha said, they had to significantly change the software of the training complex: -The company now produces three types of MANPADS simulators. This is a simulator of the Igla portable anti-aircraft missile complex, the American Stinger MANPAD and the Polish-made Piorun MANPAD. When developing a new package of programs, we took into account that a cruise missile, as a rule, flies at an altitude of 50 to 150 m, unlike airplanes that fly at an altitude of 1-5 km. Therefore, these are completely different algorithms of combat work and a completely different way of training a shooter. The angular speed of the target, the boundaries of optical detection are different, in addition, the time from the detection of the missile to the possibility of launch is significantly reduced. Usually, an anti-aircraft gunner sees a missile at the last moment and needs to orientate himself very quickly and shoot, as a rule, in pursuit. With Shaheds, the situation is somewhat simpler, because its speed is about five to six times lower than the speed of a cruise missile, up to 150 km/h. Although now there are new models with a jet engine and a speed of up to 500 km/h. The simulator program provides simulation of targets at different speeds at different altitudes and in different terrain. According to Mykola Solomakha, in addition to single simulators for an anti-aircraft gunner, simulators for the separation of portable anti-aircraft missile systems have also been developed. In particular, tablets or remote controls are used to receive external information or targeting, as it happens in real life. As experience shows, a person who has undergone training in a training center on simulators and has about two or three hundred launches behind him is able to work properly in a real combat situation. The new simulators also take into account some specific moments of work, says the commander of the anti-aircraft unit, senior sergeant Andriy: -When the launch zone is displayed on the simulator, that is, from the moment when the target is visually detected and the shooter begins tracking the target, when he points the sight and when the head captures the target and begins to give a signal that it is possible to shoot, such a concept as shooting on the parameter should be taken into account. This means that it is possible to miss a hit due to the fact that the anti-aircraft missile will have to make very sharp maneuvers and the missile may simply break due to overload. On these simulators, this moment is taken into account. And there are simulators where there is no such launch zone and the instructor does not understand how correctly the shooter acted when performing the exercise.- After exercises, the simulator automatically assigns a grade. There are also separate explanations for the instructor, who must explain to the cadet how he acted, at what points he made mistakes and why, for example, the grade was lowered. To the question of how much time a person needs to prepare from scratch and to be ready to go on combat duty, Mykola Salamakha answered as follows: -In March, April, May 2022, right here in the workshop, people practiced for several hours during 3-5 classes . During each of them, the serviceman made 8-10 launches. And after a person makes more than 50 starts, sustainable skills already appear in him. According to Mykola, it is important to constantly maintain and improve the skills of anti-aircraft fighters. If there is a trainer in the team, training should take place at least once every two weeks, if more often, then it is even better. If there is no simulator, it is advisable to send the anti-aircraft gunner for retraining at training centers at least once every six months to restore the skills he acquired during training.

Title: The caliber is smaller, the ammunition is smarter: Sweden is replenishing its BMP fleet
Description: As informs the defense portal Army Recognition, the Scandinavian country plans to purchase about 50 such weapons to replace the CV9040C models. ArmyInform reports. Reporters said that this machine, which is part of the CV90 family developed by BAE Systems Hägglunds, was presented without the additional armor that will be included in the final version. Similar presentations were held in Denmark, the Czech Republic and Slovakia. It is worth reminding that CV90 BMPs are also well known in units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. Batches of these armored vehicles were repeatedly transferred to the Ukrainian military as part of aid from the Western allies, as reported by reported by our editors. The new defense project, which received the international designation CV9035 and Stridsfordon 9035 in Sweden, combines the CV90 MkIII chassis with the turret from the Mk IV version. In May 2024, BAE Systems has signed a contract with the Swedish Defense Material Administration FMV for new CV9035 MkIIIC vehicles, as well as associated integrated logistical support. -These new CV9035 MkIIICs will enhance the capabilities of the Swedish Army and provide aircrews with improved combat awareness, increased mobility, protection and lethality,- said Tommy Gustafsson-Rusk, managing director of BAE Systems Hägglunds, which develops and manufactures the CV90. One of the most significant changes in the new BMPs is the weapon system, where the 40mm Bofors gun used on previous models has been replaced by the 35mm Bushmaster gun. This gun upgrade is expected to maintain effectiveness through the use of programmable ammunition. In addition, the CV9035 Mk.IIIC is equipped with two missiles Rbs 58, a modified version of the anti-tank complex Akeron MP, which improves the ability of BMP to hit enemy armored vehicles, including tanks. When designing the CV9035 Mk.IIIC, BAE Systems gunsmiths focused on improved protection of the armored vehicle. It weighs approximately 35 tons, such a solid weight is explained precisely by the additional reservation. The BMP is equipped with sensors and countermeasures designed to detect and respond to threats such as anti-tank missiles, including a system that can launch a defensive projectile to intercept an enemy missile. The armored car also has rubber tracks to replace the steel tracks of older models, and a rear ramp instead of the traditional hatch. BMP retains the capacity of 6-7 military personnel in the landing cabin. Added a 360-degree video camera system to improve crew situational awareness. The version shown in Sweden matches the model the Netherlands is buying, but the Swedish version will have additional armor in the final configuration. Although the exact number of vehicles and the value of the contract have not been disclosed, experts estimate that about 50 units of the new BMPs, potentially valued at $360 million, have been ordered. Armament deliveries are expected between 2025 and 2027. The CV90 BMP family, which has been in service since the 1990s, includes a wide range of variants adapted to different operational needs. These vehicles were purchased in large numbers, more than 1,700 units, performing various functions such as air defense, reconnaissance and armor recovery. The CV90 platform continues to be operated by several countries, including Norway, Finland, Switzerland, the Netherlands and Slovakia, which have adopted it for their respective defense forces. As Sweden continues to plan to modernize its fleet of infantry fighting vehicles, CV9035 Mk.IIICs are expected to play a key role in meeting the country's military needs in the coming years. New BMP CV9035 will replenish the fleet of armored vehicles of the Swedish army. Video: Ultimate Armies

Title: Cheap and angry - the enemy concentrated a large number of towed guns in the Pokrovsky direction
Description: About this on the ArmyTV stream a soldier of the 14th regiment of the Forces of Unmanned Systems of the Armed Forces with the call sign -Aladdin- told about it. -We see a lot of trailed guns. There used to be fewer of them, but now there are very, very many. We can find 7-8 of them in one flight. We also see many trucks delivering BC. It's hard to tell which howitzers are because they're usually camouflaged,- Aladdin said. According to him, the enemy uses tactics of small groups on the front line. -We see a lot of motorcycles, we see buggies, they are different, the Russians put something on them and it is difficult to recognize them, we see a lot of -loaves- and we see enemy infantry. It is not always possible to work on them all day, because we have not very good weather in this direction,- Aladdin complained. As reported by ArmyInform, the 14th regiment of unmanned aviation complexes of the Forces of Unmanned Systems of the Armed Forces caused fire damage to the Buk-M2 air defense system.

Title: -Natakha- destroy armor - ours repulsed the assault near Kurakhov thanks to unique drones
Description: The video was published on December 3 on the unit's channel. The purpose of the assault was to encircle Ukrainian troops in that area. 4 tanks and 6 infantry fighting vehicles were going to Maksimivka. But they didn't make it because they were injured. A drone and a BREM tractor, which is used to evacuate damaged equipment, were found. -Part of the armor was burned by the Natakh drones, which we mentioned earlier, and the other part was destroyed by a Sternenko river cutter. So we thank the volunteers and those who donate for high-quality efpivishkas,- the unit commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the -Cats- unit of the reconnaissance platoon of the 130th battalion of the of territorial defense showed unique shots liquidation of the reconnaissance copter of the Russians.

Title: They are waiting for new -meat- - after heavy losses, the enemy has reduced the number of attacks in...
Description: Major Nadiya Zamryga, head of the communications department of the 14th mechanized brigade named after Prince Roman the Great, told on the ArmyTV stream about this. -This indicates that in the zone of responsibility of the enemy brigade, very significant losses in manpower, equipment and weapons have been inflicted. And now the moment has come when the enemy quiets down for a while to replenish reserves. We have already observed this several times over the past six months,- said Nadiya Zamryga. According to her, there are no enemy soldiers in the brigade's zone of responsibility on the right bank of the Oskol River. As reported by ArmyInform, according to the 14th brigade, an enemy group formed in the Kupyansk direction from an extremely motley military contingent.

Title: Minus a platoon - in Kurshchyna, our marines crushed an enemy armored column
Description: The video of combat work appeared on December 3 on the brigade's channel. A mechanized column of Russian paratroopers tried to break through to our positions, but already on the approach it was hit by Mykolaiv marines and their comrades-in-arms from friendly units. The attack on the Russians was made in the place where the concrete -dragon's teeth- barricades approached the road, so the enemy could not avoid this area and became easy prey. Seeing the armored vehicles take off one after the other, the Russians tried to escape, but were hit. As a result of the battle, our marines destroyed three amphibious assault vehicles and one T-72 tank. -During the attempted assault, the enemy suffered losses of about a platoon of personnel killed and wounded,- the brigade reported. As ArmiyaInform reported, the pilots of the 36th Marine Brigade named after Rear Admiral Mykhailo Bilinskyi showed a whole series of hits at the enemy with kamikaze drones and skids.

Title: Ukraine and the United States signed a memorandum providing for the possibility of $825 million in a...
Description: About this reported to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Ukraine. The memorandum envisages the possibility of American aid in the total amount of up to $825 million. The document creates a legal framework for improving the stability of Ukraine's energy system. In particular, it envisages the restoration of critical infrastructure, the introduction of distributed generation, the reform of the energy sector and the promotion of the post-war transition to a low-carbon, competitive and European-integrated economy. As reported by ArmyInform of the United States on December 2 announced the provision of another aid package to Ukraine with a total cost of 725 million dollars.

Title: Seven enemy vehicles per day — our drones disturb the enemy in the occupied Luhansk region
Description: A video about their work was released on December 3 on the brigade's channel. They hunt fat targets, including tanks, military vehicles and armored vehicles. Operators of these drones recall that once they had as many as 7 hits in a day. The enemy no longer puts his equipment close to the line of battle, he is afraid, so he has to fly further to hunt. As reported by ArmyInform, in the Kupyansk direction, fighters from the Pomsta brigade destroyed four Russian tanks, BMP-2, cars and ATVs.

Title: They dropped theirs, but the drone did not leave — unique footage of the destruction of the Russian ...
Description: The video was released on December 3 on the battalion channel. The death of this occupier has been known for a long time, but now the fighters of the -Rarog- unit have published a detailed video of its destruction. -Yermak- accompanied propagandist Denys Kulaga, who was wounded that day. -The occupiers wanted to brag about the fabricated results, to shoot a false report, but they ran over the -gift- left by our boys at night,- the drone operators of -Rarog- reported. The wounded combatant was dragged to an open area, but when the Russians heard the approach of the drone, they remembered that -the Russians are firing their guns- and ran away, leaving the -Yermak-. It was easy for our bomber to hit the enemy combatant with a skid. The explosion was so powerful that when the smoke cleared, no bodies were left in place. It seems that the Russian combatant got to the kobzon concert in atomic form. As reported by ArmyInform, the drones of the -Rarog- unmanned systems battalion of the 24th mechanized brigade named after King Danylo hit sentimental the occupier, a bunch of equipment and a flag with a portrait of the father of the current Chechen Gauleiter.

Title: President: We expect air defense systems from several partners in December
Description: About this in the evening address said President Volodymyr Zelenskyi. -We're expecting systems now in December from several partners, plus there are certain things that can be done in January for our air shield. It is important that this is implemented without any delay. Winter is a huge temptation for Russian terrorists,- the head of state said. Volodymyr Zelenskyi emphasized that there is a direct relationship between the situation at the front and the supply of weapons from partners. -The Donetsk directions need significant strengthening. And this applies, in particular, to the supply of weapons from partners - this is a direct dependence: the greater the firepower of our army, the more technological capabilities we have, the more we will be able to destroy the Russian offensive potential and protect the lives of our soldiers. And we are talking about this in detail with our partners. And we are working ourselves — increasing our production, our Ukrainian defense industry. Our range will be greater,- the President added. As ArmiyaInform reported, NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte emphasized the need to strengthen air defense. of Ukraine from partners.

Title: The Secretary General of NATO called for strengthening the air defense of Ukraine
Description: He said this at a briefing with Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiga before the start of the Ukraine-NATO Council meeting in Brussels. According to him, first of all, it is necessary to make sure that the allies help Ukraine to maintain the energy network and energy infrastructure in the best possible condition. -Secondly, we need to make sure that when it comes to air defense, we are doing a lot, but more needs to be done to make the country as safe as possible,- the NATO Secretary General said. Mark Rutte also emphasized that it is necessary to work more actively to ensure that the promised military aid reaches Ukraine. -And I was glad today that not only the USA, but also Germany and Norway, Estonia, Lithuania and Great Britain announced new military aid packages for Ukraine. But a lot more needs to be done to make sure that you can, when one day you decide to move to some form of negotiation with the Russians, that you can do it from a position of strength,- he explained. Earlier, Mark Rutte said that Ukraine is entering another decisive winter, and Russia's aggression is not showing any signs of abating.

Title: Arrived, took aim, shot - Azov tankmen destroy Russians at close range
Description: Videos of combat work were released on December 3 on the brigade's channel. Azov tanks closely approached the positions of the occupiers and shot them with numerous hits. -Tank crews are ready to work day and night to effectively stop the enemy offensive. When the BC is completely exhausted, only ditches and liquidated occupiers remain in place of the former enemy positions,- the brigade commented on the work of its tank battalion on enemy positions in urban buildings and landings. As reported by ArmyInform, the drones of the 2nd battalion of the 12th special purpose brigade of the National Guard -Azov- Russian attack aircraft.
