The goal was to consolidate the learned vocabulary and grammatical constructions in speech practice, as well as simply the opportunity to practice speaking, practicing typical communicative situations as close as possible to real ones with the participation of a native speaker (even if it is not his native language). During such classes, students learn to overcome the psychological barrier to start speaking a foreign language, because just as it is sometimes difficult to dare to take the first step, it is also difficult to say the first word, the first phrase in English (-will they understand me-, -will I not errors-). This year, this practice of conversation clubs has spread to other higher military educational institutions that conduct foreign language courses. - Are some subjects taught in a foreign language at the NUOU? - In the center of foreign languages, we definitely teach only in English. In addition, there is also English in research for future Ph.D. But both at the university and at other higher military educational institutions, in accordance with the governing documents and today's conditions, there is a requirement to teach 20% of subjects in a foreign language. Therefore, it is necessary to improve foreign language knowledge not only of listeners, but also of scientific and pedagogical staff. To do this, we cooperate both within the internal network and with foreign partners to create a course in the direction of English as a medium for teaching other disciplines (English-Medium Instruction or English as a Medium for Instruction). In this way, we maintain, acquire or expand the capacity to study and teach in English within the university. —What do you think is the current -room average temperature- for foreign language proficiency among the Armed Forces servicemen? —Thanks to the language testing sessions, I can see the statistics and can make a cut: in fact, so far the overall temperature is— disappointing, as it is cool outside the window now. But this new -blood- that appeared in the army with the beginning of the Russian Federation's large-scale aggression against Ukraine indicates a certain tendency to increase the temperature, I will use the same metaphor - as if the heating was turned on and it's getting warmer. Those who understood that it is very difficult to achieve anything in civilian life without a foreign language, it is difficult to find a well-paid job, it is more difficult to develop professionally - they made their choice in the civilian dimension. And now they are -inspiring- their fellow soldiers with their experience. Well, it is worth emphasizing that there are many servicemen who do not wait for an order or command to learn a language, do not look for people to blame for their ignorance, but look for opportunities and time, take the initiative and start learning on their own, strive to develop, listen to recommendations - because it is the main driving force and key to success in mastering languages ​​are internal motivations and desires. I can say with great pleasure that there are more and more of them. - Do you have enough time to learn foreign languages ​​in the third year of a large-scale war? - No! Unfortunately, we confirm the effectiveness of the proverb -until the thunder strikes...-. Yes, we have started to -baptize-, but the result will take time. If you try to meet all the current needs, I jokingly say that both I and my colleagues need to be cloned! (laughs - ed.) Language is not something you can do in one or two evenings, gain some understanding and more or less master it. Language is something that is trained over time: you train your brain, you train yourself, and it is through self-discipline that you learn. But it takes time. According to our guidelines, there are 500 hours of teacher-led study from level zero to level one, which is pretty intense, and that's the pace at which four-month foreign language courses are taught. And no less important in language learning is the fact that after reaching a certain level, it is necessary to constantly maintain it, so as not to lose it, to keep what has been acquired. After all, if you do not do this, the skills will disappear, not immediately and not completely, but will become passive. Currently, there are many ways to maintain language skills - smartphone apps, news adapted to language levels, even short 15-minute lessons - but systematic - would be very appropriate. For example, we recommend Elena Chekryzhova's -Army English- project to everyone, and we broadcast her lessons to the public on the territory of our center: even passing by, you can hear something new, learn a new term. - Do you cooperate with public organizations, non-governmental institutions to improve and deepen the study of foreign languages ​​by military personnel? - Yes, and the contribution of NGOs and volunteers should not be underestimated, because the civil sector is those who, on a voluntary basis, realizing the need for the military to be included in these processes; provide translation support where necessary; continue to work and help us both abroad and in Ukraine. From November 2024, on the basis of the Memorandum of Cooperation between the Mariupol State University and the National Defense University of Ukraine, permanent and temporary staff of the university will be granted free access to educational courses on the study of the English language on the English4Ukraine electronic platform. This is another example of effective civil-military interaction. - What are your plans for improving the English course(s) for 2025? - When I am asked about the state of affairs, I usually answer -at least not worse- (smiles - ed.). As for plans, it is even more difficult, but you can use the same phrase: indeed, in 2025, we do not want to reduce our current indicators, but to increase them, of course, only under the conditions of an increase in interrelated human capital (research and teaching staff, educational facilities), so that a year later during the interview, without taking your eyes off, talk about quality quantity. We want to open more opportunities for people who want to learn a foreign language. — What interesting, funny, curious incident can you remember related to the stay of our military in an English-speaking environment? During studies abroad, during communication with partners, etc. - All these curious cases are almost always related to not quite perfect command of the language. I don't want to call these cases funny, because it demotivates those who study, strengthens the psychological barrier to language use that I mentioned earlier. And I always insisted: speak, don't be shy. After all, the foreigner with whom you speak English speaks Ukrainian worse than you speak English. One should be demanding of oneself, but the level of self-criticism should not hinder practice. And don't be afraid to laugh, and maybe laugh at yourself sometimes. Sometimes the lack of vocabulary is compensated by the ability to draw well what you cannot say, or curious cases arise not only due to imperfect knowledge of a foreign language, but also due to ignorance of cultural features, so it is always worth conducting small linguistic and cultural reviews of the countries whose language is studied. From the latest that I remember: guys are calling me and telling me: -I tell her: ``Give me keys'' - English). I meant -keys-. And the foreign interlocutor did not hear -keys- but -give me kiss- (English). Then everyone laughed…

Title: -Scorpion- is ready to attack again: Turkish defenders are bringing a new version of the armored rec...
Description: In the official release of the manufacturing company emphasized that this versatile vehicle is distinguished by advanced weapons systems and extreme mobility, which makes it necessary for a variety of military missions, ArmiyaInform reports. The new version of BBM Akrep (-Scorpion- in Ukrainian) has added to the line of armored vehicles of Otokar Otomotiv ve Savunma Sanayi A.Ş., a subsidiary of the Turkish financial and industrial group Koç Holding, which specializes in the production of buses and military equipment and whose defense vehicles ArmiyaInform repeatedlyrelate Akrep II to the BBM of the universal segment. The armored two-axle vehicle stands out for its advanced weapons systems and extreme mobility, making it useful for a variety of military missions. Unrivaled maneuverability is achieved thanks to the all-wheel drive system and the additional rear steered axle. These capabilities allow the vehicle to effortlessly navigate difficult terrains, including deep mud, snowpack or water obstacles, as well as successfully overcome natural barriers in combat conditions. If necessary, the driver of the armored car can activate the crab mode, which provides the ability to move in a diagonal direction. In this mode, the rear wheels (see video below) turn in the same direction as the front wheels. If you turn the front and rear wheels in opposite directions, the turning radius is almost halved: the rear wheels steer the car in one direction, while the front wheels steer in the other. The ability to adapt to difficult circumstances makes the Akrep II an excellent option for armies that need a reconnaissance vehicle capable of operating in extreme conditions. The John Cockerilla tower has already received high praise and is recognized as a formidable combat platform. It is designed to integrate a variety of weapon systems, including a medium-caliber automatic gun up to 90 mm. This gun has high firepower and accuracy. The turret stabilization system proved to be an effective ally for conducting accurate fire. It provides the ability to perform aimed shots even while moving, and also allows you to hit targets in different directions at short and long distances. The Cockerill LCTS 90MP turret is distinguished by its high stability and safety due to minimal recoil, which makes it the optimal choice for light shooting systems. This gun works with high-explosive shells and has effective anti-armor capabilities, which allows it to successfully perform a variety of combat missions, including reconnaissance operations. The turret system has become widespread in different countries, in particular, there are more than 300 units in the arsenal. Akrep II is designed to operate with three crew members (driver, commander and gunner) and has a total mass of 15,500 kg. With a length of 5.9m, a width of 2.5m and a body height of 1.97m, as well as a ground clearance of 400mm, this car has a compact profile that contributes to its excellent performance on the ground. The Akrep II 4X4 light armored vehicle is offered in a variety of powertrain options, including diesel, hybrid and electric. These configurations are designed to meet specific operational requirements by reducing thermal and acoustic emissions, which are particularly important for operations requiring cloaking and reconnaissance. The diesel version of the car is equipped with a 360-horsepower engine and a 6-speed automatic transmission, which guarantees reliable operation even in the most difficult conditions. Regardless of configuration, this vehicle offers a number of standard features, including central tire inflation, radial tires with Run-Flat, anti-lock braking system (ABS), as well as air conditioning systems and heating. In addition, it is equipped with five-point seat belts and an advanced driver's vision system. Additional features include Drive-by-Wire technology, a filtering system NBC (Nuclear, Biological, Chemical), a self-extracting winch and a 360° situational awareness system that provides full visibility on the battlefield. Akrep II armored reconnaissance vehicle. Video: Defensehere

Title: Matdopomoga for solving social and household issues: amount and grounds for payment
Description: How much can be received and on what grounds, saysArmyInform. Payment of financial assistance for solving social and household issues is provided for resolution Cabinet #704 and order of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine No. 260. The procedure for its payment is determined annually by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine. For the year 2024, the payment is expected to gz-na-2024-rik.pdf->by separate order of the Minister of Defense dated January 16, 2024 No. 183/unit Material assistance for solving social and household issues is paid in the amount of monthly financial support (official salary, salary according to military rank, allowance for years of service and monthly additional types of financial support (except rewards) according to the position held). Grounds for payment in 2024: Assistance is paid to the families of servicemen who are captured (except servicemen who voluntarily surrendered) or hostages, as well as interned in neutral countries or declared missing. Write a report in the name of the commander, where it is necessary to explain the reason for such an appeal, as well as provide documents confirming the existence of grounds for payment. For example, if we are talking about payment due to injury, then you need to add a certificate about the circumstances of the injury (wounds, contusions, mutilations). However, this payment is not mandatory. In resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers it is stipulated that it is the right of the commander to provide such assistance within the limits of the available monetary support fund. If the payment is approved, it will be provided once in 2024. Also this year you can get help for the previous year 2023. This is possible if the event that led to the need to receive such assistance occurred in 2023 and the right to receive it was not exercised at that time. In 2025, the order and amount of payment may change. If changes occur, ArmyInform will tell about it.

Title: The Army that reads: about the project -Book on the front-, US experience and modern innovations -Cu...
Description: The project leader, Sergeant of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Andriy Ovcharuk, told ArmiyaInform about the significance of the book at the front, the connection with the experience of Great Britain and the USA during the First and Second World Wars, and modern Ukrainian innovations. - When did the -Book on the Front- project start and what prompted its appearance? - The -Book on the Front- project started in April 2023, and I joined it from March 2024. Since in civilian life I was the head of the Kyiv office of -Stary Lev Publishing House- - opened bookstores, was a bookseller and sold books myself, I readily agreed when I was offered to lead this project and develop it. I think this idea floated in the air, because such things have already happened before. During World War I, the British and Americans gave books to their troops. Then, during the Second World War, a huge campaign was organized in the USA, during which almost 123 million copies of the books were given to the servicemen of the US Armed Forces. These books simply went to all fronts, 155 thousand boxes were sent every month, each of which contained 40 different books. In total, they had a very large list of over 1,300 items. These included classics, contemporary American literature, entertaining books - westerns, detective stories, and more. — That is, there was a significant demand for books then. Is it the same now? — When many people who were civilians yesterday and are now mobilized join the army, they bring their everyday habits and needs to the army. Our Defense Forces now number hundreds of thousands, more than a million people, a significant number of whom have read in civilian life. Getting into the conditions of war, into the conditions of military service, they retain this need to read. There are also those who are trained as readers already in the army. Military personnel or those who have interacted with military personnel know very well that in the military there are quite often situations where you have to wait a long time. For example, sitting on your belongings until the transport arrives, or being on the guard of some objects, waiting for some task or resting after its completion. Typical are situations where a significant number of people have some free time that they have nothing to do. For many, the main entertainment is the phone, but we want to offer an alternative. The phone isn't always safe, it's not always smart, it's too easy a dopamine hit. In most cases, the phone is not useful, people lose concentration, and things like attention, imagination and concentration are very important in war. - Does the book help to preserve and develop them? - Yes, the book helps to concentrate and think, especially in conditions of uncertainty. When you don't know what to do, the book can help you find a non-standard solution to the situation. Therefore, we want the military to read books and do everything possible for this. -Cultural Landing- is a big project in which musicians, singers, poets, writers, puppeteers take part. People of many creative professions who worked in the field of culture in civilian life. Currently, groups of -Cultural Airborne- travel around military units in the combat zone, visit hospitals and rehabilitation centers, where they perform in front of the military. These can be different events: poet Artem Polezhaka reads poems, puppeteer Valery Dzhek performs plays, Myroslav Jonovich Kuvaldin from the band -The VYO- plays the guitar, Vitaly Kyrychenko sings songs, the most famous of which is -Good Morning, Ukraine-. And when our -Cultural Landing- groups come to the military, they take books with them. After the performance, after communicating with the fighters, they open a box of books and offer to choose something to read. Accordingly, the military choose something to their taste that they like. —Where does the Book to the Front project get the books it distributes to the military?—In the United States, since World War II, the program to supply books to the military has been supported at the state level. The government decided that this was important for the military, who had no other entertainment than reading - when boxes of books arrived, they would instantly take them apart, read them, and exchange them among themselves. It got to the point that after frequent reading, the books simply fell apart. This, by the way, caused a real book boom after the end of the war, because after returning to civilian life, former soldiers continued to read. Book publishing, the book industry experienced a boom - the book market doubled in the first half of the year, and then doubled again in the following year. In the end, it had a tremendous impact on the development of the entire country. For us, this is now happening on a voluntary basis, so the scale is disproportionate. If in the USA during the Second World War there were tens of millions of books, then we are talking about tens of thousands. We offer ordinary civilians, visitors to bookstores, book festivals to buy a book and donate it to the -Book on the Front- project. On this book, you can write a wish, leave a note for the military who will read the book. Having collected books in the rear cities of Ukraine, we hand them over to the -Cultural Landing- groups who go to the front, to educational centers, to military units, to hospitals, rehabilitation centers - wherever there are military personnel. - A paper book has a certain weight, takes up a certain volume - it is not always convenient for a soldier to take it with him. Instead, almost everyone has a smartphone in their pocket. Does the Book to the Front project practice e-book distribution? - Yes, there are several other initiatives within which the military can access e-books. There is an initiative from online bookstore Yakaboo called The Library for Heroes. We are also engaged in the dissemination of this initiative. The reading application has a separate library that contains more than 700 e-books, several dozen audiobooks. According to the promotional code, which can be obtained from us on the -Book on the Front- project, the soldier will have access to this library and can choose anything there. You really won't carry a lot of paper books with you. For example, after reading one book that was obtained during a meeting with the Cultural Landing, I realized that I wanted to read more. So here's your promo code, pick whatever you want, there's a lot to choose from. But paper books are also important, because it is not always possible to charge a phone - electricity is needed. And many people find it more convenient to read a regular paper book - you get used to it, it's nice to flip through the pages, feel them to the touch. - What is read most often, which genres of books are most often chosen and ordered? - Most often, military personnel read fiction books. They provide an opportunity to distract yourself from the military routine, from anxiety, worries about your life. They allow you to immerse yourself in another world, experience vivid emotions. How do imagination and emotions work? They help to relax, rest, switch off from complex thoughts a little. The book helps a lot in this. Of course, there are also people who like to read non-fiction - something serious, non-fiction, self-improvement books. Many people are interested in the experience of previous wars - historical books on military topics are also quite in demand and popular. It doesn't have to be books about our war—it could be books about the Vietnam War, World War II. It happens that comics are ordered, especially in hospitals and rehabilitation centers there was a request for comics. There was even a request from the military from the combat unit to give them the manga. - And poetry, collections of poems - are they ordered, read? - Of course, poetry is very attractive, because it is a short emotional text that helps you get to your own emotions very quickly. Reading an emotional poem, you yourself begin to feel everything more deeply. You can cry, you can laugh, you can experience many different emotions when you read poetry. Many of those who order books ask for poetry. Some resort to the spoken word in training centers, reading poems to motivate fighters during training. Now there are many bright, talented poets in the army. Artur Trony, for example, writes very strong poems. Unfortunately, a very strong poet Maksym Kryvtsov died, his poems became very famous. I have already mentioned Artem Polezhaku - this list can be continued for a very long time. Military service, reliving the personal experience of war prompts both to write and to read poetry. Therefore, poetry collections are chosen for reading quite often. I had an order from one hospital specifically for poetry, I organized the collection and transfer of more than fifty collections of poetry to them. - Where can a soldier put a book after reading it? - These books are gifts, they do not need to be returned. If it is a school, hospital or rehabilitation center, the book can stay in a local, often informal, library where it can be borrowed and read by others. Most often, books are given to siblings by exchanging books. You can also mail someone, family or friends, to read this book too. This allows you to share your emotions, find a common topic for conversation. Books allow military personnel to think more deeply about and relive their own experiences, and become an additional means of communication both among themselves and with those who remained in the rear. After all, a book is an extension of life. We don't know when the war will end, but life still goes on. And books help us to continue living even in the midst of the horrors of the present war.

Title: Breaking the truth: the Russians are circulating fakes about drugs in the army
Description: By keyword search experts from -Vox Ukraine- found the original source of the photo that was distributed by propagandists. The original photo appeared on the Facebook page of the patrol police of the Dnipropetrovsk region. Law enforcement officers seized drugs from a woman in the Samara district of Dnipro. However, there is no information in the police report that the detainee was a soldier. The propagandists cropped the original photo and passed it off as a package with drugs, which are allegedly distributed among the fighters of the 95th ODSHBr. The topic of drugs is extremely popular among Russian propagandists. Propagandists have repeatedly stated that drugs are used by Ukrainian military personnel, and that the narcotic substances themselves are grown in Ukraine by Americans in biolaboratories. In particular, we can recall fakes, as if the Armed Forces of Ukraine are creating a -universal soldier- with the help of drugs, and the Third OSH Brigade is forcing recruits to use narcotic substances. All these and similar -throwbacks- by the Russians are lies.

Title: Ukraine and Norway will increase joint work for the production of weapons and energy protection
Description: This was reported by the Office of the President. The head of state thanked for yesterday's decision of the parliament of Norway to increase aid to Ukraine for the next year from 1.4 billion dollars. up to 3.2 billion dollars. and especially noted its unanimous support by all parliamentary forces. Volodymyr Zelenskyy called this a true testimony of the Norwegian people's unwavering support for Ukraine. Separately, the President emphasized that part of these funds will go to Ukraine's own production of drones and other weapons. The leaders also discussed the priority needs of Ukraine. Against the background of Russian attacks on energy infrastructure, these are generators, other energy equipment and additional air defense equipment. In addition, Volodymyr Zelenskyi thanked for the recent reception of the delegation of Ukraine led by the Minister of Defense Rustem Umyerov and the help in establishing contacts between Ukrainian and Norwegian defense enterprises. As reported by ArmyInform, Volodymyr Zelensky discussed with the President of France for urgent strengthening of air defense of Ukraine, as well as for comprehensive defense support and acceleration of the transfer of Mirage aircraft.

Title: Online booking of employees: who and how can be booked through Diya
Description: About this informs the Ministry of Digital Transformation of Ukraine. The application is processed within three days. are wanted, and those who have not updated their data. Reservations may be refused after verification. The categories of employees subject to reservation under the new procedure and the amount of reservation depending on the authorities or enterprises (institutions and organizations) are defined in paragraphs 5-13 of Resolution 1332. span> Conscripts, who are necessarily subject to reservation, work in the following positions or in the following areas: Category positions -A-: Critically important enterprises: International and sports fields: Fuel and energy complex: Technical specialists: Specialists in the field of prosthetic and orthopedic production. 50% of conscripts are reserved for other categories of workers: Authorities and local self-government: Critical enterprises: International projects and humanitarian activities: Foreign companies and media: The Ministry of Defense can decide on increasing the number of employees subject to reservation, if necessary to ensure the functioning of important areas. These rules allow balancing the needs of the country's defense with the need to support critical sectors of the economy and management. As ArmiyaInform reported, the government is restoring the possibility of online booking of employees on the Diya portal from December 1. From now on, all applications will be submitted online.

Title: The enemy's BMP is burning and burning: our fighters are smashing Russian equipment -into pieces-
Description: Video of combat operation appearedon the page of the State Border Service of Ukraine. -It will burn and burn. As soon as enemy equipment comes into view, Ukrainian soldiers smash it to pieces. This is how border guards of the Kramatorsk detachment destroyed an enemy BMP with drones the other day. The equipment was reduced to scrap by well-aimed blows of the FPV operators,- defenders commented. Previously, ArmyInform showed how operators of UAVs attack border guards in Luhansk region destroyed and damaged 8 motor vehicles, a boat and a fuel truck.

Title: Rustem Umyerov: New personnel decisions are aimed at strengthening the army
Description: This was announced by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov. -Today, together with the President of Ukraine and the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Oleksandr Syrskyi, a number of important personnel decisions were made. According to my submission, the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky appointed a new commander of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine — Major General Mykhailo Drapatoy,- Rustem reported moderated Also, an experienced commander of the 95th separate amphibious assault brigade was appointed Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Colonel Oleg Apostol. -I am convinced that the newly appointed leaders, who have combat experience, will make every effort to ensure the quality training of our servicemen and the effective performance of tasks for the defense of Ukraine,- the Minister of Defense noted. Rustem Umyerov thanked Lieutenant General Oleksandr Pavlyuk, who led the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces during a difficult period for the state, for his service. -His contribution to the defense of our country deserves respect. We continue to strengthen the Armed Forces to achieve the main goal — victory in the war and restoration of the territorial integrity of our state,- Rustem Umyerov concluded. As reported by ArmyInform, President Volodymyr Zelensky stressed on the need for changes in the structure of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, and this is precisely why the new appointments are made.

Title: Say -Siiiiir-: on the mountain paths, two suspicious tourists got into the lens of the border guards
Description: This is reported by /a> State Border Service of Ukraine. According to the coordinates, the border patrol of the -Perkalab- department of the -Selyatyn- department went to the scene of the incident. Despite the attempts of the violators to escape, the border guards detained them after a chase, during which several warning shots had to be fired in the air. As it turned out, the detainees are residents of Ternopil region. They chose a difficult mountain route to illegally cross the border, hoping to avoid detection. Administrative materials were filed against the violators under Articles 185-10 and 204-1 of the Code of Ukraine on Administrative Offenses. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: Shot down two -Shahed- in 15 minutes: the story of MANPADS operator -Loki-
Description: This is reported by Ground Forces. -Loki- is the operator of an anti-aircraft missile system in the 1129th anti-aircraft missile regiment of the Belotserkiv Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Before mobilization, Oleksiy worked as a loader, and in his free time he was engaged in programming and creating software. Today, it protects Ukrainian skies from air attacks. After the war, he plans to continue his service in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, Taras is a soldier of the Kherson anti-aircraft missile brigade, who yesterday, November 28, aimed at a Russian cruise missile from a portable anti-aircraft missile complex.

Title: The commander of the 93rd brigade - Kholodny Yar - became the deputy head of the President's Office
Description: The head of state said this in an evening address. -Combat commander, commander of the 93rd brigade -Kholodny Yar-. He understands well what is in the brigades, at the front. And I need just such a person to accurately know information directly from the front on a daily basis,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. Also today the President appointed Major General Mykhailo Drapatoy as the new commander of the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, and Colonel Oleh Apostol as the Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The President stated that Oleg Apostol will be responsible for the new quality of training of our soldiers and he has full support at all levels.

Title: The President explained the changes in the command of the Ground Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Force...
Description: He said this in his evening address. -Together with the Commander-in-Chief Oleksandr Syrskyi, today we determined that it is worth replacing the commander of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Major General Mykhailo Drapaty was appointed as the new commander. Also, Colonel Oleg Apostol was appointed as the new deputy head of the Central Committee - before that he commanded the 95th brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces,- said Volodymyr Zelenskyi. He emphasized that both are very experienced warriors. Mykhailo Drapaty this year organized the defense in the Kharkiv direction and actually disrupted the Russian offensive operation. In general, he has been at war since 2014, in the most hot and responsible areas. Oleg Apostol is a Hero of Ukraine, has passed all the command positions in the units of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, and has also been protecting our country since 2014. -He clearly knows what is needed to strengthen the combat capability of our army. Now Oleg Apostol will be responsible for the new quality of training of our soldiers. He has full support at all levels to ensure just that,- the President emphasized. Volodymyr Zelenskyi emphasized that the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces are the basis of the army and much depends for Ukraine on how effectively the structure of the Ground Forces and all Defense and Security Forces of Ukraine will work. -Changes are needed - changes in people management that will ensure more results on the battlefield,- the President said.

Title: The Defense Forces told about the unsuccessful attempts of the Russians to cross the canal in Chasov...
Description: A representative of the 24th OMbr named after King Danyla Andriy Polukhin. -The enemy has been trying to attack our positions in the city of Chasiv Yar in recent days. Their main tactic is to bypass our positions and impose a battle in the rear. But this week they also openly tried to storm, to carry out a mechanized assault. But they did not succeed, they lost a lot of equipment,- said Andriy Polukhin. According to him, the enemy is trying to complicate its offensive actions, and for this purpose it bypasses Chasiv Yar from different sides. He added that in the areas on our side of the canal, the enemy has not established a foothold, but is trying to penetrate in small groups. -Our boys identify them very quickly and work on them. The enemy is trying to accumulate forces in this way, but because of our drones, they are unable to do so,- Andriy Polukhin said. According to him, the canal itself is under fire control of the Defense Forces of Ukraine, and even if an enemy group crosses the canal, it is blocked and cut off from its forces. As reported by ArmyInform, on November 29 in the Kramatorsk direction, the invaders > carried out two assault actions near Chasovoy Yar and in the direction of White Mountain. There are currently two ongoing attacks by the occupiers.

Title: Why MRAP armored vehicles are the safest against mines
Description: Armored vehicles MRAP (from the English MRAP, Mine Resistant Ambush Protected - protection against mines and ambushes) - a class of military vehicles specially designed to protect the crew from undermining on min . The first armored vehicles under the MRAP system were produced back in the mid-70s. For the production of such cars, a special design and technological features were invented, which allow to protect the crew when hitting a mine. These machines have reduced the number of losses many times over. Due to the wedge-shaped bottom, the kinetic energy from the mine explosion is directed to the outside of the armored capsule. When making a V-bottom, it is important to maintain a certain angle. The sharper it is, the more energy is directed outwards and the better the crew is protected. At the same time, the sharp angle of the bottom increases the center of gravity and the height of the car, which reduces the car's rollover resistance and increases the height, vulnerability to anti-tank grenade launchers. When making an obtuse angle, the situation is reversed. The more obtuse the angle of the bottom, the worse the protection against a mine explosion, but the lower the center of gravity and the overall height of the armored car, which increases the protection against grenade launchers and other means of destruction. MRAP armored vehicles are designed according to the modular principle - a monolithic protected armored capsule and remote poorly protected external units: wheels, chassis elements, engine. The latter have an inertial fastening principle, that is, they absorb all the kinetic energy of the explosion. This design allows you to withstand detonation of powerful mines with minimal impact on the crew module. By the way, Formula 1 cars are designed according to a similar principle. Amortization seats and units. The design of landing seats in MRAP armored vehicles absorbs the kinetic energy of the explosion, saving the life of a serviceman. The seats are installed in the places of the least impact of the blast wave. During the explosion, the armor module moves, and the chair remains in place. According to a similar damping principle, other components are installed on armored vehicles so that during an explosion they do not harm personnel. For example, fragments of affected units fly out. Special design wheels. MRAP armored vehicles use wide, low-pressure tires with a high profile. Such tires create low pressure on the surface, so they do not activate the effect of anti-tank mines. The high profile of the tire serves as an additional explosion-absorbing factor. Strengthened ballistic protection. The armored capsule of MRAP vehicles is made taking into account the impact not only of small arms, but also of fragments from explosive devices of various strengths. An example of the application of safe technological solutions is the MRAP Buffalo. At the beginning of 2007, the US Army had 90 such vehicles in its arsenal. During the hostilities, they suffered more than 800 mine explosions without a single loss of crew. This fact provoked the Pentagon to start a program of complex procurement of such machines. The most popular foreign-made MRAP armored vehicles are Maxxpro, Casspir, Oshkosh, Mastiff, Bushmaster, Kirpi, etc. Ukrainian enterprises produce MRAP technology, in particular, armored vehicles of the Kozak, Varta, Novator, etc. families. And what about the MRAP technology in the Rosarmy? Objectively, the Russians also worked on this project. In the context of the large-scale rearmament and reform of the Rosarmy, which actively began after the Russian-Georgian war in 2008, and revived after the aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine in 2014, this technology was implemented. For example, we will give the most famous examples of armored cars that were developed by the Russians: It is worth noting one interesting detail. In the West and in Ukraine, armored vehicles, in particular with MRAP technology, are a class of armored vehicles for widespread use in the military. The Russians follow the policy of the Soviet empire: the best weapons and equipment are for the security forces, which are designed to protect the regime, and special forces. For ordinary infantry, a -three-line- is enough. Analyzing open data on orders in the Russian Federation for armored vehicles, in particular MRAPs, their main operators within the country are units of the Russian Guard, force units of the police (riot, sobr), FSB, etc. Paratroopers, scouts and sappers received BBM in the Rosarmy. But for the rest of the ground forces, the command of the occupying army is in no hurry to implement new technological and engineering security solutions, because the life and health of personnel is not a priority for them. Roman Zaporozhchenko for ArmyInform

Title: From December, employee bookings will only be available through Diya: new terms and conditions
Description: About this informs the Ministry of Digital Transformation of Ukraine. -Booking only through Diya: from now on, all applications will be submitted online. Paper orders have been replaced by an electronic system, which minimizes red tape,- the report said. New mandatory criteria: By February 28, 2025, businesses must confirm their critical status. If the company wants to book a new or already working specialist from December 1, the manager, when submitting the list for booking on the Diya portal, must confirm declaratively that the employee's accrued salary before paying all taxes will be at least 20,000. UAH This will allow the business to book new hires straight away if they meet the salary level requirements. This clause does not apply to state and communal enterprises, as well as residents of Diya.City. Enterprises that belong to one of the following categories can book conscript workers: Certain criteria must be met in order to receive the status of a critical enterprise. Mandatory Business Criteria: Additional Criteria, you must select at least one: Process for obtaining Critical Business Status: Businesses that have not yet upgraded but already have Critical Business Status will be able to book workers - this booking will be valid until February 28, 2025 and no longer than the criticality period. After updating the criticality under the new mandatory criteria, businesses will be able to book workers for up to 12 months, as before. As reported by ArmyInform, the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, based on the results of the audit of enterprises and organizations that have the status of critical and have the right to reserve employees, decided to change the criteria.

Title: The GUR reported the number of ballistic missiles and artillery systems that the DPRK transferred to...
Description: This was reported by the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine in response to a request from Interfax- Ukraine. The GUR noted that the DPRK began supplying artillery systems to the Russian Federation in October. In total, more than 100 pieces of equipment of various types were moved, including: 170-mm self-propelled artillery installations M-1989, 240-mm multiple rocket systems M-1991. The supply of large-caliber artillery ammunition and short-range ballistic missiles of the KN-23/24 type from the DPRK to the Russian Federation continues: as of November, more than 5 million units and 100 units have been delivered, respectively. -At present, more than 60 units of 170-mm self-propelled guns M-1989 Koksan have been moved from the territory of the DPRK to the territory of the Russian Federation, part of which was planned to be delivered to the Saratov VAKU, probably for the purpose of training personnel. There is no information on the state of the specified artillery systems,- the GUR added. As reported by ArmyInform, North Korean ballistic missiles KN-23/KN-24 identified components of foreign production.

Title: Eight Ukrainian children were returned to Ukraine
Description: informs about this On November 29, the Commissioner of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine for Human Rights Dmytro Lubinets wrote in his telegram -channels. According to him, this was achieved within the framework of the implementation of the approved action plan of the President of Ukraine Bring Kids Back UA. Returned children between the ages of 6 and 16. Some of the children have diseases, so they were met in Ukraine together with the ambulance. Among those returned is a boy who at the time of the Russian invasion was in the -Oleshkiv Children's Boarding Home-, whose pupils were taken by the occupation authorities to the city of Skadovsk and the Russian Federation. -Family circumstances and the lack of prospects for a good future for the children prompted the adults with whom the little Ukrainians were staying to take decisive action - return the children to the territory under the control of the Government of Ukraine,- the message reads. Dmytro Lubinets noted that 7 children were returned with the involvement of the intermediary country Qatar. Another boy was returned through the humanitarian corridor. -But now these children will finally receive decent medical care, hug their parents and relatives and implement their plans,- he noted. State bodies and public organizations will help families send their children to school, provide psychological and humanitarian assistance, and promote social integration. Finally, children will have a stable environment in which to grow. -If your child has disappeared, and you, as his legal representative, do not know his whereabouts, be sure to report this fact to the National Police of Ukraine by dialing 102. If you are sure that the child was deported to the Russian Federation, or he is in a detention center, then in addition to the police, we, the Office of the Ombudsman, should also be notified,- urged Dmytro Lubinets. As reported by ArmyInform, previously on the territory under the control of the government of Ukraine /-> managed to take 23 Ukrainian children from the temporarily occupied territories of Kherson, Zaporizhzhia and Luhansk regions. Among them are three orphans.

Title: The presidents of Ukraine and France discussed speeding up the transfer of Mirage aircraft
Description: This is stated in the message of the head of state in the Telegram channel. -I thanked France for its willingness to help with the urgent strengthening of Ukraine's air defense, as well as for comprehensive defense support and speeding up the transfer of Mirage aircraft,- the message reads. Volodymyr Zelenskyi emphasized the importance of inviting Ukraine to NATO, expanding long-range capabilities — not only as a necessary measure to counter Russian aggression, but also to bring peace closer — and continuing the training and equipping of Ukrainian brigades both on the territories of the member states of the Alliance and through the development of the proposed by France ideas about training missions on the territory of Ukraine. -I highly appreciate that France understands the challenges we are facing. We discussed in detail how to strengthen air defense and protect the lives of our people,- the head of state added. As reported by ArmyInform, in June 2024 the transfer of Dassault Mirage 2000 fighters to Ukraine announced the President of France. Later, French Defense Minister Sebastien Lecornu announced about the time of the transfer of fighters - as early as the first quarter of 2025.

Title: The SDF explained how much time the military has to return from the SZH
Description: This was stated by the adviser to the director of the State Bureau of Investigations on Communication, Tetyana Sapyan, informs -cas-do-1-sicna-sob-povernutisa-iz-szc-derzburo-rozsliduvan.html-> Ukrinform. -If you went to the SZCH as a military serviceman, you have the opportunity to return to the military unit from the end of November to January 1 of the new year, that is, in a month,- said Tetyana Sapyan. After the service member returns to their duty station, the commander has 72 hours to extend the contract or reinstate you. Cash, food and in-kind payments, as well as benefits and social guarantees, are being renewed. -When a serviceman returns to his military unit, he is obliged to inform the pre-trial investigation body or the military law enforcement service that the serviceman has returned to defend the borders of Ukraine. This is the algorithm of actions for today,- the SBI explained. November 28, President Volodymyr Zelenskyi pishov-u-szch/->signed bill No. 12095 on voluntary return to service for those who voluntarily left for the first time military unit or deserted. As reported by ArmyInform, servicemen who voluntarily left their units for the first time instead of imprisonment start return to the front. ArmyInform explained the return procedure in detail in the material — SZH and desertion: how to return to the service and not sit behind bars.

Title: The enemy shelled the Dnipro region: 40 private houses were damaged, a gymnasium was damaged, a lot ...
Description: reported this on the evening of November 29, the head of the Dnipropetrovsk Regional State Administration Serhii Lysak. The enemy targeted Nikopol, Mirivska, Pokrovska and Marganetska communities. The occupiers damaged more than 40 private houses and more than 20 farm structures, one of which was completely destroyed. -The main thing is that no one was hurt. However, there is a lot of destruction. A gymnasium and a car wash were damaged. Damaged infrastructure, solar panels, greenhouses. It hit gas pipelines and power lines,- said Serhii Lysak. As reported by ArmyInform, attacks by Russian troops continue in Dnipro region, the enemy attacks the region with various types ofweapons.

Title: Warrior Taras shot down a cruise missile during one of Russia's largest combined missile-drone strik...
Description: told more about the fighter in the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. -The morning of November 28, 2024 seemed tense for the defenders of the Ukrainian sky. During one of the largest combined missile-drone strikes, Russia used up to 200 missiles of various types and UAVs. Soldiers of mobile fire groups destroyed eight enemy missiles in the south of Ukraine,- the military recalled. It is noted that one of the cruise missiles was shot down by Taras. This is the second enemy air target he has eliminated as part of a mobile fire group in the past two weeks. The previous shooting was on November 17. Then the soldier also destroyed a Russian cruise missile. -I am an anti-aircraft gunner from the first day of service in the army, so I know my job well,- says the soldier. — Got into the Kherson anti-aircraft missile brigade back in 2016, when he was serving his military service. I liked it, signed a contract, and I am fighting in this unit to this day,- said Taras. The man was born and grew up in the south of Ukraine. Here he got married and became a father. Therefore, he does not know from words what the Russian occupying forces are doing in Ukraine, and how to protect his native home and family. -We must defeat the enemy, protect every family, every child, parents, every piece of native Ukrainian land and sky. For this, we need to strengthen the army,- he emphasized. Taras urged everyone to join the fight against the aggressor, to join their Kherson anti-aircraft missile brigade. -Our team is excellent. Together we can hasten the Victory. In the meantime, let's continue to destroy the enemy!- - he summarized. As reported by ArmyInform, on the night of November 28, 2024, as a result of an anti-aircraft battle -ta-naslidky-vorozhoyi-ataky/->almost 90 percent of the winged Kalibr and Kh-101 missiles.

Title: The hero of Ukraine Oleg Apostol told how his 95 beat the enemy: interview
Description: The Hero of Ukraine Oleg Apostol was the commander of the 95th Separate Airborne Assault Brigade of the Polish Army until today. In the spring, the correspondent of ArmiyaInform recorded a long interview with him, we suggest that he be recalled on the occasion of his new appointment. The great war that Russia started against Ukraine 10 years ago, during this period many young but extremely experienced military personnel grew up. who have already entered the history of modern Ukraine as talented military leaders. One of these is the commander of the 95th Separate Polish Airborne Assault Brigade, Hero of Ukraine, Knight of the Cross of Combat Merit, Full Knight of the Order of Bohdan Khmelnytskyi, Colonel Oleg Apostol. During the ten-year war, the paratrooper fought for Slovyansk and Luhansk airport, liberated the Mykolaiv thermal power station in Donetsk region, and from the beginning of the large-scale invasion, also populated areas in Mykolaiv region. With the appointment to the post of commander of the 95th brigade of the Russian Armed Forces, Colonel Apostol led the battles in the Serebrian and Kupyan forests, and now continues to organize defensive and offensive actions in Donetsk and Luhansk regions. Exclusively for ArmiyaInform, Hero of Ukraine Oleg Apostol talked about his combat journey from platoon commander to brigade commander. — What are the most significant combat episodes of the paratroopers since 2014, in your opinion, will go down in the history of Ukraine? — Undoubtedly, the well-known raid (the raid of the Ukrainian paratroopers, which began in July 2014 during the anti-terrorist operation - ed.), defense of Luhansk and Donetsk airports, battles for Debaltseve. During the breakthrough to Luhansk airport, I led a combat reconnaissance platoon, then I was in the position of deputy battalion commander. The occupiers then tried twice to set up ambushes on the advance route. Having calculated the dangerous areas in time, they decided to play it safe. Ordered two tanks and an armored personnel carrier to occupy the designated line. It saved us and prevented us from being destroyed. Everyone knows that 80-90% of ambushes do not survive… But the commander should always be able to calculate everything in advance, because then it saves many lives and enables the completion of the task. — Tell us about your first battle with the enemy. — June 2, 2014, when everyone went to storm Sloviansk and Lyman. I was tasked with bringing three artillery batteries into a designated area to support operations. Two batteries were equipped with 122 mm howitzers, and one with 152 mm. I was driving behind the 79th DSHV brigade, and then they were ambushed on the climb to Sloviansk. At that moment, I stopped the convoy, because I realized that the 79th was operating with one of the Jaguar special units. All of them are charged, and I have three armored personnel carriers, one -zushka- and three batteries that are covered with tents and not ready for combat. Then the 79th broke through and went forward to Liman, we stood in a column, and the enemy was on our right and left. I understood that the enemy might start to outflank us, so I gave the command to turn off the headlights, turn right and left, and we took up a circular defense. 15 minutes have passed I got on the armored personnel carrier and decided to move forward. I thought then that if I leave and nothing happens, then we will jump by 2-3 cars. When we realized that the enemy had withdrawn, we first thought how lucky we were, because if the enemy had not made such a mistake, it is difficult to imagine what could have happened if three batteries, each with 6 howitzers and ammunition, had been ambushed. ; This is actually the first moment of the battle, but then there was the first contact battle, when I liberated the Mykolaiv TPP. The first time we went there, it was difficult to detect the enemy, and we conducted reconnaissance by combat. The second time, we already knew where all their firing points were, and we simply stopped them with direct fire from tanks. In fact, after we regularly held them at gunpoint, they began to run away. For the third time, we broke through, unblocked Mykolaiv TPP, occupied the commanding heights - and after that Slovyansk was liberated. - What are the most memorable combat episodes since you became the commander of the 95th brigade? - The first is the assault in the direction of the settlement of Kreminna. We had great success there, but the only thing we lacked was effort. Of the four battalions, only two advanced, because the other two were in other directions. We broke ahead, we literally lacked two kilometers. After that, the enemy brought in significant reserve forces, we switched to defense with the task of defending the Kreminny direction. Secondly, this is the defense of the Kupyan forest, at times it seemed that everything was about to fall, but the enemy could not withstand the dynamics of the fighting. This was clearly visible from their assaults. At first, they attacked 15-20 people several times a day. Then 6–8 Russian soldiers, then two people, and then once a day, a couple tried to go on an assault. As soon as such a turning point comes, we immediately tried to regain the lost positions, which we did. - What units of the Russian army did you have to fight against? - We were in the Flint Forest opposite the 76th Airborne Assault Division, which included the 104th Guards Airborne Assault Regiment, the 234th infantry regiment and the 237th Guards parachute regiment On the eastern side, they concentrated the 228th motorized rifle regiment, the 80th tank regiment, and the 4th separate motorized rifle brigade. I am sure that this enemy remembered us well, because we crushed them so much that some units went out to recover. In the Kupyansky Forest, -Sturm Z- and -Sturm V- stood against us, and when the -Zeks- were finished, the personnel left - the 25th Separate Motorized Rifle Guards Brigade, the 138th Separate Motorized Rifle Brigade - this was real -meat -. Analyzing the actions of the enemy, you ask yourself the question, how can you just send people to slaughter like this? But I cannot understand this, because my commanders did not act like this with their personnel. And he himself would never do that to his people. At Terny, units of the 20th Guards Combined Arms Army and some assault units of the Tank Army tried to storm us. They have the same tactics here as in the Kupyan forest. They also go in packs, they just put people down. By the way, they call themselves -Kyiv Russia-, but in fact they are simply distorting our history. The most stupid thing is that their people are led by such narratives and believe that it is normal to send people to their death. All this is welcomed by the people, because then they can buy a car. Of course, it is worth noting that the -stacking- tactics of the occupiers is paying off. We have seen this in Bahmut, Soledar and other destinations, but our advantage lies in pure intelligence and technological development. — Your brigade took many prisoners. Will they admit their guilt for all the evil they have committed on our land? - When the occupiers are captured, they immediately become different people. It is clear that at first the characteristic phrases are heard: -We have been abandoned, we are offended by everything and everyone, barefoot, poor, unhappy and hungry.- They behave as prisoners should, they don't show their character, they give us information about where their command posts are, what paths they took, who is senior. If compared with the captives who were at the beginning of the large-scale invasion and now, then I call this -party- mercenaries, because they stupidly go to kill for money. No one catches them and forces them to go fight against Ukraine and kill our civilians and military. This is a purely conscious choice of each of them. When I talk to them before handing them over to replenish the exchange fund, they all say that they were aware of the possibility of their death, but they came to make money. But we understand that they have come to destroy our people. And there is nothing sacred about them. - Which settlements did your brigade liberate? - Our brigade de-occupied Dovgenka, Krasnopill, Makarivka, Pasika, Dolyna, Kamianka, Sukha Kamianka, Studenok, Koroviya Yar, Yatskivka, Krymka, Synycheno. Then they moved to the settlements of Krymka, Shandrigolovo, Zelena Dolyna, Kolodyazi and reached Ploschanka. The Kharkiv operation was well planned by the senior commander, it was correctly selected units, the direction of our shock fist, support and a clear assessment of the enemy. The enemy really relaxed then, they were confident - and that also worked against them. While still a member of the 80th DSHV brigade, he met the war in the position of battalion commander. Such a first moment, which will be remembered forever and will go down in history, is the defense of the settlement of Voznesensk. After successfully repelling the enemy's offensive, we moved to offensive actions. And then they liberated the following settlements in the Mykolaiv region: Arkhargelske, Katerynivka, Kashpero-Mykolaivka, Novopetrivske, Novofontanka, Dobrokamyanka, Ingulets, Vynogradivka, and in this way we reached Yavkina, and already near Snigurivka we supported the enemy. The outlying villages that we held there were: Shiroke, Chervona Dolyna and Kobzartsi. Oh, and we won trophies then! - Which trophies were the -fattest-? - Well, the most I can point out is REB -Resident-. In addition to it, there were gas tankers, water tankers, bathhouses, armored personnel carriers, tanks of various models of the T-72BZ type and modifications, D-30 howitzers, engineering vehicles, MT-LB, pickup trucks, many shells and even to the Grad anti-aircraft missile system. In general, we received such a normal lend-lease from the Rashists, it was -gifted- to us by the 126th separate brigade of the coast guard and the command post of the army. - How has the training of Ukrainian paratroopers changed over these 10 years? - Definitely for the better. Everything we invest in the training of young recruits is invaluable experience forged in battles on our own experience. We in the brigade have developed our own material base and assembled a group of experienced instructors who skillfully manage personnel for each type of combat and explain all the nuances. For me personally, the combat training of personnel is extremely important. — A few months ago, I saw with my own eyes how you set an example and taught the paratroopers of your brigade. To be honest, I was impressed not only by your professional approach, but also by how much your actions motivate the personnel. — Yes, then I gathered my instructors and another certain category of officers and showed all those points that need to be improved in preparation for further training of soldiers on the battlefield. Of course, these are not all dogmas and things are different in battle, but absolutely all situations are analyzed from real battles. We constantly monitor the enemy's channels, watch how our defenders act, analyze where there was success and what caused it, and where we could have done differently. That is, constant analysis of oneself and the enemy gives an understanding of how to plan the course of hostilities. If a person is trained and clearly knows what he should do, then this is already a great destiny of success, because it is the soldiers who forge our Victory in the trenches. And then an extremely important point is the moral and psychological state of my paratroopers. All of us are waiting for our relatives at home. A person should always understand what he is fighting for and what will happen if we do not fight, if we do not overcome this evil now, then Russia will not let us go so easily and will destroy us. — At the beginning of the large-scale invasion, many Ukrainian media underestimated our enemy and dispelled myths that the occupiers were weak and weak. What can you say about this and how often the enemy changes? - If they were weak and weak, we would have knocked them out long ago to the borders of 1991. You can never underestimate your opponent. Russia is a really big machine with a huge human resource, which they do not spare. They are abandoning their people by the thousands and will continue to do so, because history repeats itself. In addition, the occupiers learn quite quickly. Many examples can be given. Russia learns a lot from us and uses it against us in the future. - Did you dream of becoming a paratrooper as a child? - Definitely yes. I never considered infantry or other types of troops. When I was little, in the 7th grade, I had about 300 toy soldiers, up to 100 pieces of equipment, aviation, special forces. All the money that I saved and that my relatives gave me, I spent on my plastic army. I put them against each other according to the scenario, simulated the landing of the landing force and developed various battle sequences. It happened that I was so engrossed in the placement of soldiers that I did not come to the actual battle. After all, I was a child, and I switched to another game, for example, I went to play football, because the placement itself took more than an hour. I have also loved historical films and the history of Ukraine since childhood, constantly read memoirs and historical novels. It was then that my desire to become a soldier was born, I could not see any other way for myself. - What personally gives you strength and how do you motivate your personnel? - Gives strength when the day or battle has passed without loss. War dictates its terms, so you can never get too lazy. I understand that it can be difficult for me mentally at times, because you are constantly worrying about your people, that they are all alive and well, but we understand that it is the hardest for the soldier there. Yes, we plan everything with the brigade leadership, combatants, conduct reconnaissance, provide artillery support, but nothing will happen without soldiers. Therefore, I sincerely want all people to respect our real heroes, because many of them have already given the most valuable thing - their lives. Russia is an enemy and an evil that we must stop. I have lived in this world for a reason, at least we have already avenged both the Cossacks and the Kruts. Now our job is to reclaim the rest of ours. Here you are either the hunter or the prey. — What do you wish for the youth who dream of joining your ranks? What traits do they need to nurture? — DSHV is an elite. I even tell my boys, when they're a little off balance, to remember that they're paratroopers! It will always be difficult, because war is merciless and unfair. We all realize what a tremendous amount of work has been done here to earn the proud title of paratrooper. I wish the youth to cultivate courage, to be physically hardy, to study the entire history of Ukraine, because this is not the first time we are fighting this enemy. Putin's appetite is growing, and it will not stop. He is becoming, and may have already become a copy of Hitler himself, without realizing it. Everyone will have to fight, it is necessary to accept it as it is and with a cold mind. The main thing is to remember and honor all our fallen Heroes! Photo by the author and the press service of the 95th separate Polish assault brigade.

Title: During the day, Russian troops attacked residents of Kharkiv Oblast
Description: reported this by Oleg Synegubov, the head of Kharkiv OVA. -As a result of an attack by the Russian army, a civilian 74-year-old man died from a fatal wound,- the message reads. As reported by ArmyInform, yesterday Russian troops ->delivered a series of strikes on Kharkiv Oblast, causing damage to infrastructure and the death of civilians residents As a result of a missile attack on Kharkiv, the production buildings of the enterprise and the glazing of the windows of a multi-storey residential building were damaged.

Title: The ideological supporter of racism, who pointed Russian missiles at the defense plants of Kharkiv, ...
Description: About this informs November 29 SBU. According to the investigation materials, an employee of a local pharmaceutical company turned out to be an enemy accomplice. Under the guise of business trips, the agent collected information about military facilities, including defense enterprises, and -matched- their coordinates with locations on Google Maps. SBU counter-intelligence exposed the suspect and arrested him during a special operation in the regional center in September 2023. -During the search of his apartment and car, mobile phones were seized with maps of the locations of potential targets, which he tried to pass on to the FSB,- the statement said. According to the investigation, the convict came to the attention of the occupiers as an ideological supporter of racism, about which he repeatedly wrote on Russian social networks. -After recruitment, the agent used a conspiratorial channel of communication with the FSB with the help of anonymous chats in instant messengers, which he registered on the phone numbers of foreign operators,- the SBU said. According to the materials of the Security Service, the court found the intruder guilty of 2 Art. 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (treason committed under martial law). As reported by ArmyInform, Security Service of Ukraine detained five persons, who justified Russian aggression and were waiting for the full occupation of the country. Their activities were conducted in Kyiv, Kharkiv and Donetsk region.

Title: North Korean ammunition is flying in the wrong direction: the occupiers complain about the allies
Description: This is what told on the air of the telethon -Edyny Novyny-, lieutenant colonel Nazar Voloshyn, spokesman of the Khortytsia operational-strategic troop grouping. According to Nazar Voloshyn, first of all, they complain about the lack of ammunition. Then there is a lack of food and even water. The problem with logistics became especially acute with the onset of cold weather. -It's trite, but they even complain about the lack of warm things. And we have information that Russian servicemen are complaining about difficulties in using ammunition supplied by North Korea. That is, they don't fly where they need to go,- Nazar Voloshyn noted. Previously ArmyInform reported, in the Pokrovsky, Kurakhivskyi and Vremivskyi directions, the enemy is completely destroying shelling and bombing of Ukrainian cities and villages.

Title: He survived because his son made him run: the story of the rescue of a border guard in the Kharkiv r...
Description: About this informs State Border Service of Ukraine. One of such attacks was shelling from Grady, when the positions of the border guards were literally destroyed. There were defenders in the dugouts, and in the forest - the border guard Vadim with the call sign -Obolon- and the position commander. After the shelling ended, the commander rushed to save his comrades, but came across a mine that detonated. -Our commander was cut by shrapnel, a lung was pierced. We quickly gave him first aid and evacuated him. Fortunately, he is now recovering and will hopefully return to us soon,- says Obolon, who temporarily took command of the position. The border guards rebuilt the fortification from scratch, putting all their strength into it. -We do this for ourselves, because it is our security, and for our commander - so that he is satisfied with our work,- Obolon adds. Vadim, who used to work in Kyiv, says that he repeatedly thanked his son for the habit of running: it was she who saved his life during attacks. The man hopes for a quick end to the war and calls on Ukrainians to join the border brigade -Hart- to fight together for victory. -Only by joint efforts will we be able to overcome the enemy,- he is convinced.

Title: Damage to an oil base and the failure of an elite unit of the Russians: a stream from a front-line c...
Description: Elite units advanced from the side of the invaders, but after a skirmish they had to retreat. They did this very slowly, so our artillery gave them an acceleration. Defense forces hit an oil depot and destroyed the radar station of the Buk-M3 air defense system. As in the summer, the tanks of the -Atlas- oil depot in the Rostov region caught fire again. And the radar station of the Buk-M3 anti-aircraft missile system was destroyed in the temporarily occupied territory of the Zaporizhzhia region. Tank 63 OMBr visited the Russian positions. First, he mowed down the landing with a machine gun, and later, to consolidate the result, he sent the invaders several shells from a cannon. These and other topics are discussed by the presenters - Captain Artem Golub and Major Andriy Makarenko.

Title: The President named the new commander of the Ground Forces and the deputy commander-in-chief of the ...
Description: About this he wrote on November 29, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi. -Together with the Central Committee, several personnel decisions were made for our army. The main task is to significantly increase the combat capability of our army, ensure the quality of training of servicemen and introduce innovative approaches to people management in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The Ukrainian army needs internal changes to fully achieve the goals of our state,- the head of state said. According to him, Major General Mykhailo Drapaty successfully organized the defense in the Kharkiv direction and disrupted the offensive operation of the Russian forces. Colonel Oleh Apostol is an experienced commander of the 95th separate amphibious assault brigade. -Both have proven their effectiveness in battles,- the President emphasized. As reported by ArmyInform, previously the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky emphasizedthe tragedy of war, which affects children the most. In his statement, he noted that the concepts of -war- and -children- are two polar realities that should not exist side by side.

Title: The forces of unmanned systems hit an interesting military target of the Russians worth $10 million
Description: Video of the combat work published on its page by the Command of the Unmanned Systems Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine . It is noted that the target illumination and missile guidance radar station (RPN 9С36М) is a key element of the anti-aircraft missile complex. Its value is estimated at about 10 million dollars. -The detection and destruction operation was carried out by the operators of the 412 OBBps NEMESIS, once again proving the effectiveness of the SBS in weakening the enemy's air defense,- they said military As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 42nd mechanized brigade /->filmed from a copter a city that has been stormed by Russian troops for several months.

Title: Toretsk was completely destroyed by artillery: the Russians are razing the city to the ground
Description: The spokeswoman of -Luhansk- OTU told about this on the air -Suspilne Novosti- Major Anastasia Bobovnikova. According to Anastasia Bobovnikova, everything is very difficult in the Toretsk direction. There, the enemy uses small assault groups, of which there are many. -In fact, they attack with -meat assaults- under the cover of artillery and aviation. You can see what Toretsk looks like. Now the footage is very scary, there is not a single whole house left. Everything was completely fired by the artillery. And plus constantly KABy, KABy, KABy. There may be 10 KABs per day,- Anastasia Bobovnikova said. Previously ArmyInform reported that in the Toretsk direction the enemy is constantly replenishing its personnel - every night it brings in -live meat- and delivers weapons, but there are problems with food.

Title: The enemy began to actively operate in the Vremiv and Lyman directions
Description: This is reported in the operational information of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 16 :00 November 29. The border areas of Chernihiv Oblast, Sumy Oblast and Kharkiv Oblast continue to suffer from Russian artillery shelling. A number of settlements, including Bleshnya, Porozok, Mykhalchyna-Sloboda, Gremyachka, Progress, Nova Huta, and Vidrodenivske, were hit by the shelling of the terrorist army today. In the Kharkiv direction, the occupiers twice stormed the positions of our units in the area of ​​Vovchansk and Tykhi. One battle is still going on. Six times the enemy attacked our positions in the Kupyansk direction. Ukrainian defenders repelled enemy assaults near Kolisnikivka, Lozova, Pershotravnevoy and Zeleny Gay. On the Lyman direction, enemy units attacked in the Grekivka, Novoehorivka, Terniv, Yampolivka, Dibrova, Torsky, Zarichny, Hryhorivka areas and in the Serebryansk forest. Since the beginning of the day, Ukrainian soldiers have already repelled 16 attacks. In the Kramatorsk direction, the invaders carried out two assaults near Chasovoy Yar and in the direction of Bila Hora. There are currently two ongoing attacks by the occupiers. In the Toretsk direction, Ukrainian defenders repelled an enemy attack in the Druzhba district, and enemy aircraft also struck Oleksandr-Kalynovy and Oleksandr-Shultyny. In the Pokrovsky direction since the beginning of the day, the occupiers have already made 21 attempts to dislodge our defenders from their occupied positions in the areas of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Dachenske, Chumatske, Novy Trud and Zhovte settlements. The defense forces repulsed a total of nineteen enemy attacks in the direction. The enemy suffers heavy losses in manpower. The largest number of clashes was recorded at this time in the Kurakhiv direction. The invaders attacked our units 33 times, trying to advance in the areas of the settlements of Sontsivka, Berestka, Novodmytrivka, Zorya, Kurakhove, Dachne, Dalne, Elizavetivka, Hannivka, and Uspenivka. Ten fights are ongoing. In the Vremivsk direction the invaders carried out 22 attacks on the positions of the Ukrainian troops near Vesely Hay, Kostyantynopolskyi, Suhy Yalyi, Rozdolnyi and Novodarivka. Eleven skirmishes are ongoing, and the enemy aircraft also struck Novosilka and Makarivka with guided air bombs. In the direction of Gulyaipole, the enemy is using attack aircraft, hitting the area of ​​the settlement of Gulyaipole with unguided air missiles. In the Dnieper direction the enemy made one unsuccessful attempt to storm the positions of Ukrainian units. In Kurshchyna, Ukrainian defenders repelled 11 attacks by Russian invaders today, the fighting continues. We remind you that last day the losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 2030 people. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed 8 tanks, 33 armored combat vehicles, 34 artillery systems, 89 operational-tactical UAVs, 86 cruise missiles, 86 vehicles and 3 units of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: The results of the Security Cooperation Forum: who ignored the hysteria of the Russian Federation
Description: The FBS is the OSCE's main platform for arms control, as well as disarmament, confidence-building and security measures, on the basis of which it cooperates for stability in the Euro-Atlantic and Eurasian regions. Russia tried to disrupt this meeting even before it began. In particular, during the adoption of the agenda, the Russian delegation stated that there was no consensus regarding the proposed project. In their statement, the Russians demanded from Denmark: The Russian delegation also demanded to immediately start consultations between the Russian Federation and Denmark with the involvement of -third parties-, in particular Malta and the OSCE Secretariat. In response to Russia's actions, the presiding country resolutely confirmed its position on the impossibility of blocking the agenda, which contains only minimal items (-General statements- and -Other-). The Danish side also rejected accusations of abuse of power. Only Belarus supported the Russian demands, and the delegations of the EU, Ireland, Sweden, the USA, Switzerland, Romania, Croatia, Ukraine, Poland, Latvia, France, Great Britain and Georgia expressed their full support for the Danish approach and called for the continuation of the meeting. All this theater was organized to disrupt the performance of Ukraine at the FBS.
