The Russians covered the dacha with artillery — wounding a civilian and damaging a private home. In Pokrovsk, a children's playground was damaged by a drone strike. The enemy hit Druzhkivka with three UMPB D-30SN aerial bombs - there is damage in the industrial zone. In Andriivka, 10 private houses and a car were destroyed as a result of the hit of the -FAB-250- bomb. The occupiers fired at Yampil with -Smerch- MLRS and damaged 8 private homes. In addition, it was established that 8 apartment buildings were damaged in Myrnograd as a result of a bomb attack that occurred on November 11. The police and SBU opened criminal proceedings under Art. 438 (violation of the laws and customs of war) of the Criminal Code of Ukraine. Another 214 people were evacuated, including 10 children. Since the beginning of mandatory evacuation — 316,573 people, among them 36,789 — children, 8,531 — people with disabilities. As reported by ArmyInform, on November 11, the Russians twice /->hit Kramatorsk and the suburbs. Read more read in our report.

Title: Air defense effectively responded to the combined Russian strike — President
Description: This announced President Volodymyr Zelensky. -They shot down Russian missiles, in particular ballistic missiles, cruise missiles that attacked Kyiv, as well as drones. In total, about 90 attack drones attacked Ukraine,- the head of state said. The President emphasized that our forces have enough to protect the country from Russian terror and thanked each of the partners for their help. -To deliver anti-missile missiles for our air defense on time, to fulfill agreements on defense systems, on the production and supply of EW, is, without exaggeration, to be saviors of people. Each such manifestation of the effectiveness of our air defense means saved lives and protected infrastructure. And the more results our soldiers have, the closer the end of the war will be. This is how peace is achieved through strength,- Volodymyr Zelenskyi said. As reported by ArmyInform, on the night of November 13, the enemy -udar-rosiyi/-> struck Ukraine with various types of missiles, guided aerial bombs and attack drones.

Title: 4 rockets and 37 martyrs were shot down — Air Force about Russia's night strike
Description: This was reported by the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on November 13. A total of 96 air attack vehicles were detected by the radio engineering forces of the Air Force (not including air defense systems): – 2 S-300 anti-aircraft guided missiles from the Kursk region. - Russian Federation in Sumy Oblast; – 2 Kh-101 cruise missiles — Russian Federation. from Tu-95MS strategic bombers, the launch area is the Caspian Sea; - 2 -Iskander-M-/KN-23 ballistic missiles, launch area, Voronezh region. - Russian Federation; - 90 strike UAVs of the -Shahed- type and unmanned aerial vehicles of an unspecified type from the Kursk, Primorsko-Akhtarsk, Orel regions - Russian Federation. The air attack was repulsed by anti-aircraft missile troops, aviation, electronic warfare units, mobile fire groups of the Air Force and the Defense Forces of Ukraine. As of 10:00 a.m., two Kh-101 cruise missiles, two Iskander-M/KN-23 ballistic missiles and 37 enemy UAVs were downed in the Kyiv, Poltava, Zhytomyr, Sumy, Cherkasy, Zaporizhia, Chernihiv and Kirovohrad regions. 47 enemy drones were lost in different regions of Ukraine, two UAVs left the airspace of Ukraine in the direction of Belarus and Russia. Two more drones are in the air, combat work continues! As reported by ArmyInform, last night Ukraine repelled the attack 110 enemy drones.

Title: -Possibility to translate in several scenarios-: the MOU explained the details of the new system
Description: Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine told about this on the air of the telethon -Edyny Novyny- on issues of digitization Kateryna Chernogorenko. According to Kateryna Chernogorenko, the government adopted a resolution that regulated the process of submitting an electronic report. A guaranteed response will be available within 72 hours. -Now the report can be submitted in a few minutes directly in the mobile application. And the step-by-step prompts that we provide in Army+ will allow our soldiers not to forget to add important data that is needed to approve such a transfer,- said Kateryna Chernogorenko. In addition, according to the Deputy Minister, transfers between units will be accelerated. This can be done in several scenarios. -This is from a combat unit to a combat unit. From the rear to the combat unit or from the combat unit to the rear, only if there is a corresponding decision of the military medical commission. If a person does not hold a position in his brigade that corresponds to this conclusion of the VLK,- added Kateryna Chernogorenko. As reported by ArmyInform, the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine from of digitalization Kateryna Chernogorenko answered a question from social networks about the legal responsibility of commanders for deliberate negligence that resulted in the loss of personnel.

Title: Attack from above - our drone rammed a Russian -mavik-
Description: The video of the combat operation was released on November 13 on the brigade's channel. Our drone was monitoring the enemy when it noticed a Russian -mavik- below. Our pilots decided to attack and hit the Mavik from above. He lost control and fell to the ground. -Our drone returned home intact and received a downed Mavic badge on its fuselage,- the team commented on the video.   As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 60th mechanized Ingulets brigade made a selection of the most terrible deaths of the occupiers.

Title: Consequences of a rocket attack in Kyiv region: debris from rockets damaged buildings, there are vic...
Description: This was reported by the head of Kyiv OVA Ruslan Kravchenko. A 48-year-old man was injured as a result of falling fragments of downed targets. He suffered head injuries, but his condition is satisfactory. After providing the necessary medical assistance on the spot, the man refused to be hospitalized. In the Brovary district of Kyiv region, the debris of the downed objects damaged the building and caused a fire in the warehouse. The fire was contained, rescue services continue to work at the scene. As reported by ArmyInform, troops The Russian Federation launched a combined missile-drone attack on Kyiv for the first time in the last 73 days.

Title: The Armed Forces damaged -two other important objects of the Russian invaders-
Description: This is stated in operational information of the General Staff ZSU as of 08:00 on November 13. However, our soldiers inflict significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupying troops and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear. Over the past day, missile troops and artillery of the Defense Forces hit 13 areas of concentration of weapons and military equipment, two warehouses of ammunition and fuel and lubricants, four artillery pieces and two other important objects of the Russian invaders. As reported by ArmyInform, The defense forces repelled 47 enemy attacks in the Kurakhiv region and 20 in the Kursk region. We will remind, last day losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 1770 people. Also, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed 24 tanks, 49 armored combat vehicles, 56 artillery systems, 61 UAVs of operational-tactical level, 96 cars and three units of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: For the first time in 73 days: Russia launched a missile-drone attack on Kyiv
Description: This was reported by Serhiy Popko, head of the Kyiv City Military Administration. For the attack, the enemy probably used air-launched cruise missiles, Iskander-M ballistic missiles and Shahed drones. An air alert was announced in Kyiv at 06:30 due to the threat of UAVs from the east, and at that time the missiles were already heading towards Kyiv region. At the moment when the cruise missiles approached the capital, the enemy launched a ballistic attack. The attack ended with another wave of drones. The air alert continued for over two hours, during which the Defense Forces destroyed several cruise and ballistic missiles, as well as up to a dozen enemy drones. As of now, there is no information about the destruction or casualties in Kyiv. As reported by ArmyInform, -Molniya-1- drones attacked Kharkiv: houses were damaged, local residents suffered.

Title: Drones -Molniya-1- attacked Kharkiv: houses were damaged, local residents suffered
Description: reported the head of Kharkiv OVA Oleg Synegubov about this. At 3:38 p.m. in the Saltivskyi district of Kharkiv, the strike of the -Molniya-1- drone damaged the windows of a high-rise building and two cars. A 70-year-old woman was injured. At 2:00 p.m., in the Slobid district of Kharkiv, the impact of another drone damaged electrical resistance and window glazing in three high-rise buildings. Two women, aged 55 and 50, were injured. Also at 8:45 p.m., enemy aircraft struck the village of Udy of the Zolochiv community with guided air bombs and near the village of Odnorobivka. There were no reports of injuries or damage. During the day, 67 people were evacuated from the Kupyansky and Borivskyi directions. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy attacked Kharkiv with drones, there are wounded .

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -For the purpose of commemorating the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, fortitude, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who died while performing combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, I decree: to start holding a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, to be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: The defense forces repelled 47 enemy attacks in the Kurakhiv direction and 20 in the Kursk region
Description: This is stated in operational information of the General Staff ZSU as of 08:00 November 13. According to detailed information, yesterday the enemy launched two missile strikes against the positions of Ukrainian units and populated areas using four missiles, as well as 87 airstrikes, dropping 151 anti-aircraft missiles. In addition, he carried out 5168 attacks, 110 of them from rocket salvo systems. Yesterday, in the Kharkiv direction, the enemy stormed the positions of our units in the Vovchansk area eight times. In the Kupyansk direction, 17 attacks by the occupiers took place during the day. The defense forces repelled enemy assaults near Kolisnykyvka, Zagryzovy, Kruglyakivka and Lozova. In the Lyman direction the enemy attacked six times. Tried to advance near Novomykhailivka, Grekivka, and Torskyi. In the Severskyi direction, Ukrainian soldiers repelled an attack in the Verkhnokamyansky area. In the direction of Toretsk, the enemy, in some cases with the support of aviation, carried out 11 attacks near Toretsk and Shcherbinivka. In the Pokrovsky direction, our defenders stopped 28 assault and offensive actions of the aggressor in the areas of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Hryhorivka, Pustinka and Novooleksiivka settlements. In the Kurakhiv direction Defense forces repelled 47 attacks. The occupiers most actively tried to advance in the districts of Illinka, Novoselidivka, Voznesenka, Novodmytrivka, Dalnyi and Antonivka. In the Vremivka direction, the enemy carried out 15 assaults on our positions in the districts of Trudovoy, Maksimivka, Makarivka, Rivnopol and Novodarivka. Actively involved attack and bomber aircraft for strikes on the direction. In the Dnieper direction Russian invaders attacked our positions five times. They were repulsed and suffered losses. In the Volyn and Poliske directions no signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected. On the border with the Chernihiv and Sumy regions, the enemy from the territory of the Russian Federation is actively using artillery and aviation in the areas of Ukrainian settlements. An operation in the Kursk Oblast is ongoing, where Ukrainian soldiers restrained 20 offensive actions of the invaders. Also, the Russian terrorist army does not stop bombing its own territories; according to the available information, the enemy carried out 24 airstrikes using 34 anti-aircraft missiles last day. Our soldiers inflict significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupying forces and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear. In general, last day losses of the Russian invaders amounted to 1770 people. Also, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed 24 tanks, 49 armored combat vehicles, 56 artillery systems, 61 UAVs of operational-tactical level, 96 cars and three units of special equipment of the occupiers.

Title: 30 units of equipment and a battalion of infantry - in Kurshchyna repulsed a large assault
Description: The video of the combat work was published on the brigade's channel. The first three units of enemy armored vehicles were blown up by mines, the next ones were destroyed with the help of the Stugna ATGM and FPV drones of the unmanned systems battalion. colleagues from neighboring brigades worked on other equipment. -The failed mass offensive of the occupiers in the Kursk direction! The -Magura- brigade, together with the adjacent units, stopped the assault of the Russians, who became somewhat more active in this direction,- the brigade commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, two crews of the Bradley 47th Mechanized Brigade mowed the landing in which the enemy planted.

Title: In the Kherson region, 10 people were injured due to Russian strikes, high-rise buildings were damag...
Description: This reported the head of the Kherson Regional State Administration Oleksandr Prokudin. Last day Sadov, Inzhenerne, Stanislav, Shiroka Balka, Bilozerka, Veletenske, Chornobayivka, Zelenivka, Komyshany, Antonivka, Mykilske, Berislav, Novoberislav, Havrylivka, Shlyakhove, Mykolaivka, Mylove, Novokairy, Olhivka and the city of Kherson were under enemy fire and airstrikes. the Russian military targeted an educational institution, an administrative building, and the local fire department; residential quarters of settlements in the region. In particular, the enemy damaged 5 high-rise buildings and 32 private houses. The occupiers also vandalized the utility building, warehouse, and private cars. As reported by ArmyInform, during the day, November 12, occupiers inflicted 510 blows on 16 settlements of Zaporizhzhya region.

Title: The occupiers shelled the Zaporizhzhia region more than 500 times a day
Description: This was reported by Ivan Fedorov, the head of Zaporizhzhya State Administration. After 20:00, the enemy made 6 strikes on the territory of Zaporizhzhya and Vasylivsky districts. A high-rise building was damaged in one of the settlements. A 69-year-old woman was injured as a result of Russian attacks. Russian troops carried out 22 airstrikes on Zaporizhia, Kamian, Kushugum, Stepnohirsk, Kamian, Primorsky, and Malya Tokmachka. 323 UAVs of various modifications attacked Bilenka, Primorske, Lobkovo, Gulyaipole, Shcherbaki, Novoandriivka, Novodanilivka, Mala Tokmachka, Biloghir and Novodarivka. Lobkovo, Novodanilivka, Novodarivka and Mala Tokmachka were shelled by 8 rounds of anti-aircraft fire. 157 artillery shells were fired on the territory of Lobkovo, Orikhov, Gulyaipol, Shcherbaki, Novoandriivka, Novodanilivka, Malaya Tokmachka, Biloghir and Novodarivka. 25 reports were received about the destruction of residential buildings and infrastructure facilities.

Title: More than 1,700 soldiers and half a hundred artillery systems — the General Staff of the Armed Force...
Description: Such data was published on the morning of November 13 by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The total combat losses of the enemy from 24.02.22 to 13.11.24 are estimated to be: The data is being refined… As reported by ArmyInform, the Armed Forces repelled over 150 enemy attacks.

Title: Hand-to-hand against FPV — footage of attacks by Russian attack aircraft on our drones
Description: The video was published on the brigade's channel. -The occupiers engage in close-range shooting battles with drones and engage in hand-to-hand combat, try to fight back with a butt and hide in sheds. The result is one: -missed - killed-! The last shots from the lives of the occupiers before death are in the video from our pilots,- commented the video in the battalion.   As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 3rd assault brigade used against the occupiers in the Kharkiv Region napalm rains, which were provided by our glorious dragon drones.

Title: During the day, as many as 23 vessels passed through the Kerch Strait in the interests of the Russia...
Description: About this, as of at 06:00 on November 13, the Naval Forces of the Ukrainian Armed Forces reported. There are no enemy warships in the Black and Azov seas. There are 2 enemy ships in the Mediterranean Sea, one of which is a carrier of -Caliber- cruise missiles with a total firing of up to 8 missiles. Russia continues to violate the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea of ​​1974 (SOLAS) by disabling automatic identification systems. As reported by ArmyInform, the commanders of the Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the Navy of Denmark -sytuacziyu-v-chornomu-mori/->discussed joint projects and the situation in the Black Sea.

Title: Equipment in the water, corpses in the grass — 5 Russian columns were destroyed in Kurshchyna
Description: The video was released on on the battalion channel. the Russians tried to break through the water obstacles, where their armored vehicles were stuck, and the landing party was then finished off. -It is difficult to assess the results now. In this video, you can see only a small number of dead enemies, captured in just one drone flight. Imagine how many losses the enemy suffered in this area yesterday. The battle was led by several brigades of the Defense Forces,- the 225th battalion commented on the video.   As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the Black Swan strike group of the 225th assault battalion demonstrated fantastic accuracy in destroying the Russians.

Title: The offensive of the occupiers was stifled in all directions: the Armed Forces repulsed more than 15...
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The invaders launched one missile strike with two missiles, 69 airstrikes, shot down 106 anti-aircraft missiles, and also used 873 kamikaze drones on the territory of Ukraine. At the same time, the enemy fired 4,178 shots at the positions of our troops and settlements. In the Kharkiv direction the enemy stormed the positions of our units near Vovchansk eight times. according to calculations, the losses of the enemy in the direction amounted to 85 servicemen killed and wounded, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed seven units of enemy vehicles and 23 UAVs. 12 cars and a unit of special equipment were also damaged. Seventeen times the enemy stormed the positions of the Ukrainian military on the Kupyansk direction in the districts of Kolisnykyvka, Zagryzovo, Kruglyakivka and Lozova. On the Lyman direction, the Russian invaders tried to advance six times in the Novomykhailivka, Grekivka, and Torsky districts. The defenders of Ukraine steadfastly hold the defense, inflicting significant losses on the enemy. In the Severskyi direction, Ukrainian soldiers repulse an attack in the Verkhnokamyansky area, the situation is under control. On the Toretsk direction the aggressor attacked ten times for aviation support near Toretsk and in the Shcherbinivka area. Currently, two clashes are ongoing. In the Pokrovsky direction, a high intensity of hostilities is maintained. The number of clashes has increased to 28. The invaders continue to attack our positions in the direction of Myrolyubivka, Promin, Lysivka, Hryhorivka, Pustinka and Novooleksiiivka settlements. By this time, our defenders have repelled 19 attacks, nine clashes are ongoing. Preliminary losses of the aggressor amounted to 445 occupiers killed and wounded. Two tanks, two cannons, three cars and three motorcycles of the occupiers were also destroyed, while another two cars and four motorcycles were damaged. In the Kurakhiv direction there were 47 combat clashes of varying intensity. The occupiers most actively tried to advance in the districts of Illinka, Novoselidivka, Voznesenka, Novodmytrivka, Dalniy and Antonivka. The fighting continues. In the Vremivka direction, the aggressor, with the support of aviation, stormed the front edge of our defense 13 times in the area of ​​Trudovoy, Maksimivka, Makarivka, Rivnopol and Novodarivka. Six clashes are still ongoing. In the Dnieper direction, five enemy attempts to storm the positions of our soldiers failed. The defense forces hold back the onslaught of the Russian occupiers. The department honored the soldiers of the 44th separate artillery brigade named after Hetman Danylo Apostol and the 126th separate brigade of the Territorial Defense Forces, who bravely held their positions, skillfully repelled enemy attacks, inflicting significant losses on the invaders. As reported by ArmyInform, The Defense Forces of Ukraine hit the enemy formation PMM on the territory of the Russian Federation.

Title: Next, probably, cavalry, bicycles: an expert on stocks of military equipment in the Russian Federati...
Description: -If we talk about the replenishment of the enemy's troops with combat equipment, then, for example, the entire tank repair industry of the Russian Federation with joint efforts produces about 150-160 tanks every month. About 30% of them are the newest - those assembled from scratch at the Uralvagonzavod. All the rest are cars that have been restored after they were wrecked in Ukraine. Or these are machines that were taken from storage, reanimated and sent to the front. Accordingly, if the enemy produces 150-160 vehicles per month, they will collect 1,920 tanks in a year. The Dutch site Oryx counts the losses of this war. But he counts not just the ones shot down in battle, but the completely destroyed machines that can no longer be restored. So, the Dutch counted a total of 3,494 destroyed tanks from the Russians for the entire time of the fighting. That is, with a production rate of 1,920 tanks per year, the enemy covers its losses without problems. But there is one caveat. The tanks that are now being delivered to the Russian army are older years of production. Because this is what is taken for storage, reanimated and supplied to units. If we receive cars from the allies somewhere in the 70s, 80s - if we are lucky, the first half of the 90s, then the enemy has them in the 60s. The difference in technical capabilities is obvious. the Russian Federation does not produce tank sights at all. They buy them in Belarus. Joint-stock company -Peleng- takes care of their production. It collects 145 -Sosna- sights and 40 of the latest -Sosna-U- sights in a year. On the eve of a large-scale invasion, the Russians purchased optical sights from France. All this was sanctioned. Accordingly, it is necessary to buy in Belarus. According to the sights, it turns out that the Belarusians are able to provide for the Russians. The Russian Federation even has the ability to change broken sights on tanks and keep something in stock. The situation in the Russian Federation is worse with artillery, because cannon barrels, first of all, are long. Second, it is a laborious process. Thirdly, the machines that are needed for drilling and cutting are high-precision equipment that cannot be bought so easily in the market. There were rumors that 10 machines were purchased by the Russians through Austria. But there are fewer than a hundred such machines throughout Russia. And the need for cannon barrels is thousands. Therefore, you can take what you have, repair it and give it to the troops. Accordingly, no one cancels the concept of -fatigue- of metal. The laws of physics apply. What was in storage will definitely have a shorter service life. Separately, it is necessary to say about the means of anti-aircraft defense of the enemy. It was already known in 2022 that the Russians do not have enough workers at factories. Russia produces such devices, but these are high-tech systems that require a lot of components, radio electronics, processors. And they are not produced in the Russian Federation. Accordingly, all this is imported through gray routes, very long supply chains are used. This is far from always military products, it can be purely civilian radio electronics, and it has other, for example, temperature ranges… And, accordingly, they can do something with air defense, but it will take a long time. And as we knock out their anti-aircraft missile systems, it becomes more and more difficult for the enemy to replenish them. Plus, friends from Iran urgently asked for S-300. the Russians took them to Crimea and sent them to Ayatoli. Then Israel flew there, crumbled everything into a fine vinaigrette. All five of the five long-range radar stations were destroyed. Ayatollah says: -Well, guys, give me more, because I need it, because they will fly again.- And the Russians are on such a normal split now: either for themselves or for their allies. But the Allies gave the Russians ammunition of scarce denominations, for example, 115 mm shells for T-62 tanks, which have a specific gun with such a strange caliber. British intelligence estimates that the adversary will exhaust its reserves of armored vehicles, meaning tanks and armored fighting vehicles, by the fall of 2025. Next, probably, cavalry, bicycles, what else could be there… We have already seen electric scooters. But we cannot yet talk about the fact that the Russian defense industry is on the verge of collapse. It still has considerable potential. Their much bigger problem is the lack of skilled labor. Also, these are problems with components, which are becoming more and more difficult to get. After all, the expert community and volunteers monitor what and where it comes from, and through diplomatic and not-so-diplomatic ways, partners are provided with data about it, and such schemes are cut off wherever they can be detected. Therefore, this is exactly what will restrain the Russian defense industry. They are now at their best. Because they should implement the fourth shift? Well, the day is not rubber. Switch to an eight-day work week? But they have already switched to a seven-day one. In the area of ​​the same Uralvagonzavod in Nizhny Tagil, in the 23rd year, they began to build a zone where it was supposed to concentrate specialists with technical skills, who are serving sentences for any articles. Probably in order to attract them to work at the tank factory. Therefore, they have already exhausted all the possibilities that the Russians have. There is no possibility to increase something. In particular, also in aviation: because they are already involving Belarusian specialists to restore the MiG-29. Therefore, I think that we will not see the collapse of the Russian defense industry, but we will see a certain stagnation.

Title: -Cossacks- in the service of the Defense Forces of Ukraine: how they created the well-known armored ...
Description: It is about the family of these BBMs, its history and development that the correspondent of ArmiyaInform talked with Andriy Kharuk, a well-known researcher of military equipment and armaments, doctor of historical sciences, professor of the Department of Humanities at the National Academy of Land Forces named after Hetman Petro Sahaydachny. — Andriy Ivanovych, in accordance with the distribution of machine-building production capacities in the former USSR, Ukrainian enterprises, in particular, manufactured formidable tanks and tractors, while the republic's car factories could only boast of rather clumsy -Zaporozhians- and -scary- Volynyankas. Therefore, during the collapse of the Union, our state did not inherit enterprises for the production of wheeled armored vehicles. Where did the -Cossack- genealogy begin? — If we recall the history of the company producing the current BBMs -Kozak-, the private joint-stock company -Praktika Scientific-Production Association- was founded in Kyiv in 1993. Initially, it was engaged in the production of civilian armored objects - bank safes and vaults, secure server rooms, etc. In 1998, the company mastered the production of collector armored cars, and ten years later tried to enter the market of military armored vehicles. — And what was the start of this enterprise in the defense market? — In 2009, -Praktyka- produced a prototype of an armored car on the Iveco Daily 55S18W all-wheel drive chassis. The machine, which received the name СРМ-1 -Козак-, had a welded body of MILUX steel armor (Finnish production) with four side doors and one aft. A 7.62-mm or 12.7-mm machine gun, or a 30- or 40-mm automatic grenade launcher could be installed on a manually operated turret on the roof of the hull. SRM-1 was relatively light - 5.5 tons. This indirectly indicates a not too high level of armored protection (armor thickness was only 5 mm, armored glass in the windows - 56 mm). Designers paid attention to mine protection: the passenger capsule has a double V-shaped bottom. Additional protection against the blast wave is provided by the batteries and the fuel tank located in the double floor. That -Kozak- was equipped with a four-cylinder Iveco F1C turbodiesel (3-liter displacement, 176 hp) and a six-speed ZF6S gearbox. The prototype was displayed at the Independence Day parade on August 24, 2009. The firm launched an extensive marketing campaign, showing -Cossack- at various exhibitions. Interest in the armored car was apparently shown by Nigeria, Pakistan and about a dozen other countries, but it was not possible to receive a single order. The low price did not help either - the company declared that the price of the SRM-1 in the basic version will be only 125 thousand dollars. Even cheaper should have been the version on the chassis of the GAZ-66 truck (with the replacement of the carburetor engine with a diesel one). - That is, at the prototype level, the activity of the manufacturing company in the field of defense then stopped? - Interest in the -Cossack- grew after the beginning of Russian aggression in 2014. On September 2, 2014, the prototype was demonstrated at the National Guard training ground in Novy Petrivtsy, Kyiv region, and on September 24-27, in Kyiv, at the exhibition -Weapons and Security - 2014-. However, in its current form, SRM-1 did not interest the military. In the end, the prototype -Cossack- was bought from the company by the US Embassy and handed over to the Ukrainian border guards on January 20, 2015. - However, a powerful enemy onslaught clearly cannot be stopped with one machine, let alone a prototype. How did events develop further? — The beginning of Russian aggression in 2014 became an incentive for many Ukrainian manufacturers to offer their products to the Defense Forces. However, SRM-1 did not suit the military. The main drawback of the first -Cossack- was insufficient protection, and it was not possible to strengthen it due to the weak chassis. So in 2014, when Praktiki specialists started designing a new armored car, they chose a heavier Iveco Eurocargo 150 E28 4×4 chassis (in the Iveco line, the Eurocargo family occupies an intermediate place between the light Daily cars and the heavy Stralis). The prototype, known as -Kozak-2014-, retained the general features of the SRM-1, but the use of a different chassis made it possible to strengthen the armored protection - it corresponds to level 2 according to the STANAG 4569 standard. The combat weight increased to 15 tons, but the dynamic characteristics did not deteriorate thanks to the diesel 250 hp engine Depending on the purpose of the car and the layout of the internal volume of the body, it can transport from 5 to 11 soldiers plus two crew members - a driver and a commander. — But this armored car, as far as is known, was only an intermediate option, right? — In the spring of 2015, a new version of the armored car appeared on the Iveco Eurocargo chassis — -Kozak-2-. It was distinguished by a significantly improved body, a six-cylinder Iveco Tector diesel engine with a working volume of 5.9 liters and a power of 279 hp. and a number of other improvements. The front suspension is an independent spring, the rear is a dependent spring. The armored body is welded from MILUX steel sheets. Italian anti-trauma seats with five-point seat belts are installed for the crew and landing party. The machine is equipped with a filter ventilation unit of Turkish production and a radio station of the Ternopil plant -Orizon-. Armament in the basic version was mounted in an open tower of the -crown- type. The first two copies of Kozak-2, shown on March 14, 2015, at the training ground in Novy Petrivtsi, were armed with 12.7-mm NSVT-12.7 machine guns. However, other weapons options were also allowed - a 7.62 mm machine gun or an automatic grenade launcher. And in May 2015, the Kozak-2, additionally armed with the Stugna-P ATGM, was demonstrated at the training ground of the 169th Desna training center. - And how did this BBM sample perform in field tests? - Tests of the Kozak-2 armored car were conducted simultaneously in the interests of the National Guard and the Armed Forces. In January-February 2016, the machine passed state tests at the training grounds of the State Scientific and Testing Center of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in Chernihiv, the training center of the National Guard of Ukraine in the village of Stare of the Kyiv region and on the basis of PJSC -NVO -Praktyka--. In particular, on February 17, one of the prototypes at the National Guard training ground underwent practical tests for anti-mine and anti-bullet resistance. A charge of TNT weighing 6 kg was detonated under the bottom of the cars, and the armored car was also fired at with a 5.45 mm AK-74 machine gun, a Dragunov sniper rifle, and a PKM machine gun (7.62 mm caliber). Although the armored car was damaged, the crew in a real battle would definitely survive in the event of such damage. These tests were the first in Ukraine to be conducted in accordance with the requirements of the STANAG 4569 standard. - So the -second- Kozak satisfied the military? was officially adopted by the National Guard of Ukraine under the designation SBA (specialized armored vehicle) -Kozak-001-. The Ministry of Defense was more scrupulous when making decisions: on November 3, 2016, Kozak-2 was admitted to operation during a special period (Order No. 588), and on March 21, 2017, it was taken for armament by Order No. 158. This document justified that -Kozak-2- is designed -for the transportation of personnel, samples of weapons, military cargo and property on all types of roads and terrain; conducting tactical operations such as patrolling; escorting vehicles during special tasks; transmission of orders and provision of communication; fire support of personnel in battle, as well as for the protection of the crew and cargo, personnel from the fire of small arms caliber 7.62 mm, fragments of ammunition and mines.- - And when was their serial production started? - The National Guard ordered the first 22 Kozak-2 armored cars in June 2015 - a year before the official acceptance for armament, and even before the completion of state tests. Obviously, the production of these machines was already underway, because the customer received the first ten of them already at the beginning of July. On February 11, 2016, the first six -Cossack-2- were handed over to the State Border Service of Ukraine. The Armed Forces of Ukraine received the first batch (ten Kozak-2 vehicles) in November 2017. At that time, the National Guard and the State Border Service already had more than 100 such armored vehicles. In August 2019, the general director of Praktika reported that more than 200 Kozak-2 armored vehicles have already been handed over to law enforcement agencies, and another batch of 40 vehicles is being prepared for handover. Another batch, which included more than 40 armored vehicles, was handed over in December 2020. — Regarding the Ministry of Defense: where did these BBMs come from? — In the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Kozak-2 armored vehicles were supplied primarily to units of the Airborne Forces - assault troops. For example, in March 2019, 33 such vehicles were transferred to the 13th separate airborne assault battalion of the 95th separate airborne assault brigade (Zhytomyr), and in December of the same year, Kozak-2 was delivered to the 81st separate airborne brigade (Kramatorsk). In December 2020, the 88th separate marine infantry battalion (Bolgrad) of the 35th separate marine infantry brigade received about 40 armored vehicles of this type, and in 2021, the 36th OBrMP also received such vehicles. Twelve -Cossacks-2- from this brigade took part in the parade in honor of Independence Day in Kyiv on August 24, 2021. The cost of Kozak-2 in 2017 was UAH 8.4 million, and for the contract concluded in December 2019, it reached UAH 9.28 million. This was explained by the increase in the minimum wage and the increase in energy prices. - If it's not a big secret, do you know how much special car data has been collected? Did they take part in the battles in the east of Ukraine? - The total number of Kozak-2 armored cars produced is not known for sure, but it can be estimated at about 300 units. In 2020, two of them were exported to Indonesia for testing, the rest are actively used by the Defense Forces of Ukraine. The National Guard tested its Kozak-2 vehicles in combat conditions in the area of ​​the anti-terrorist operation back in 2015. Later, the armored vehicles of the Armed Forces also visited the battle, in particular, in January 2020, 35 OBrMP vehicles arrived in the zone of operation of the United Forces. - But the most active and serious tests awaited these BBM already during the large-scale invasion of the Russian invaders - After the beginning of the large-scale Russian invasion, Kozak-2 armored vehicles are actively used in battles on all fronts. At the same time, as a result of the redistribution of Kozak-2 equipment, new units appeared in the arsenal - for example, in April 2023, two such armored vehicles were handed over to the 101st Territorial Defense Brigade. - However, even production vehicles need improvement. During operation, the military sees certain defects and expresses its wishes for modernization. And how was it, Professor, with this sample? — A significant drawback of the Kozak-2 armored car is the frame structure with the use of a civilian chassis (albeit with four-wheel drive). This limits the vehicle's ability to pass. Therefore, the next stage of the evolution of armored cars from their manufacturer was the creation of a car with a monocoque supporting body. This variant was called -Kozak-2M1-. It uses the same units (diesel engine, six-speed manual transmission) as on the Kozaku-2, but the undercarriage is completely redesigned. The suspension of all wheels became independent (its elements are supplied by a specialized company from the Czech Republic), and the ground clearance increased from 392 to 430 mm. At the same time, thanks to the rejection of the frame, the overall height of the car even decreased. -Kozak-2M1- differs from its predecessor in significantly better cross-country ability, smoother movement, higher speed of movement over rough terrain. The capacity of the armored car and armament correspond to the -Cossack-2-. The Kozak-2M1 prototype was first presented at the -Arms and Security-2016- exhibition in the fall of 2016. From October 2018 to July 2019, the machine underwent state tests, which were completed successfully. On April 3, 2020, by order of the Minister of Defense, the -Kozak-2M1- was adopted by the Armed Forces of Ukraine. It is classified as an -armored combat wheeled vehicle- - BBKM. — And what decision did the military leadership make regarding this vehicle? — In January 2020, there were reports of an intention to purchase 140 Kozak-2M1 armored vehicles for the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The Ministry of Defense has officially announced that starting in 2020, the purchase of Kozak-2 and Varta vehicles will be stopped, and Kozak-2M1 will be purchased instead. Public opinion -expressed dissatisfaction- with the significantly increased price, which amounted to 10.5 million UAH (above, we indicated that -Kozak-2- cost 9.28 million UAH; for comparison, we cite the prices of other armored vehicles: -Varta- - 6.9 million , Novator 8.1 million, Oncilla 8.3 million). However, as it seems to me, an explanation can be found: unlike the Kozak-2 and Varta, the Kozak-2M1 armored car does not use a civilian -militarized- chassis, but is a special military design with much higher performance characteristics. In November 2021, tests of the Kozak-2M1 armored car equipped with a remotely controlled Sarp Dual module (with 12.7 and 7.62 mm machine guns) produced by the Turkish company Aselsan were completed. However, serial machines were delivered with an old version of armament - a -crown- type turret. — That is, literally on the eve of the great war, these machines entered the troops. Where exactly? - December 6, 2021. The first batch of Kozak-2M1 armored vehicles - 44 armored vehicles - was handed over to the Armed Forces of Ukraine. 20 of them went to the 122nd separate battalion of the 81st OMBr, and the rest went to the Special Operations Forces: 14 to the 3rd Separate Special Purpose Regiment and 10 to the 73rd Naval Special Operations Center. Data on the supply of new batches of these machines after the start of the full-scale Russian invasion were, for obvious reasons, not published. There will be…

Title: Russians are sending fake messages to Ukrainians on behalf of -Evil Mavka-: what are they writing
Description: -Our defenders at the front are greatly exhausted and are suffering huge losses. Men no longer cope alone. We should not wait for tomorrow, when women's mobilization will become mandatory. Let's take the initiative and come to the TCC today!- - says the fake message. Representatives of -Zlaya Mavka- noted that they do not write on behalf of the movement to anyone in personal messages and do not do mass mailings. -Now we can definitely say that it was a coordinated and expensive attack. Various messengers, mail, posts on separatist pages (thank you, monkeys, who promptly sent all the screenshots and followed up, and who immediately understood that it was a fake). As we can see, this attempt was unsuccessful, but the level of it shows that they feel threatened by the very thought that we are here at the TOT and are doing non-violent resistance. We do not know what they wanted to achieve, scandal or discrediting of the Zla Mavka movement. But it's not interesting. We have to do our own thing,- they said on the official Telegram channel of the resistance movement. the Russians send similar messages to sow panic among Ukrainians, because in reality there are no plans for the mandatory mobilization of women into the ranks of the Armed Forces. Women's mobilization will continue to be voluntary.

Title: In the Zaporizhzhia region, an explosive wave damaged several floors of a building
Description: This was reported by Ivan Fedorov, the head of the Zaporizhzhya OVA. According to preliminary information, several floors of the entrance of a multi-story building were damaged by the blast wave in one of the settlements. Emergency services are already on their way to the scene. There are currently no reports of casualties. The scale of the destruction is being clarified. As reported by ArmyInform, in vorog attacked the critical infrastructure of Shostka: city without heat.

Title: The defense forces of Ukraine hit the enemy composition of the PMM on the territory of the Russian F...
Description: This was reported by the General Staff of the ZSU. The results of combat work are being clarified. According to preliminary information, a fire broke out on the territory of the facility. Damage to such objects creates serious logistical problems for the army of the Russian invaders and significantly reduces their offensive potential. As reported by ArmyInform, the Defense Forces strike on the composition of fuel and lubricants in the area of ​​the city of Rovenki in the temporarily occupied territory of the Luhansk region.

Title: The enemy attacked the critical infrastructure of Shostka: a city without heat
Description: informs Sumy OVA about this. As a result of the attack, the city of Shostka was left without heat supply. Emergency and rescue services are working at the site, which are dealing with the consequences of the impact. Currently, information about the extent of damage is being clarified. Currently, operational measures are being taken to restore heat supply to the city as soon as possible. As reported by ArmyInform, Nikopol is under fire: rosarmiya attacked the district with -Hrads- and drones. We will remind you about the series of shelling in the Kherson region: Russian troops injured ten civilians.

Title: Ambassador of Ukraine to Britain: defense cooperation is the key to a stable future
Description: This was announced by the Ambassador of Ukraine Valery Zaluzhnyi during a round table in the Parliament of Great Britain on the topic -British-Ukrainian defense cooperation and common threats-. Valery Zaluzhnyi expressed his gratitude to the British partners for their constant support and emphasized the importance of cooperation in the field of defense. According to him, the victory of Ukraine depends on consistent assistance in the defense sphere, strengthening of defense capabilities for a long time and post-war reconstruction plans. He also emphasized that the joint production of defense products will allow a faster response to challenges, reduce costs and, most importantly, save the lives of Ukrainians. The ambassador thanked the British partners for their willingness to build a peaceful future together with Ukraine and expressed confidence that joint efforts will create a stable and safe world for future generations. As reported by ArmyInform, the third a group of pilots of the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine completed training at the base of the Royal Air Force in Cranwell.

Title: With the dearest in the trunk: border guards stopped a non-standard trip to Moldova
Description: About this notified the State Border Service of Ukraine. A 32-year-old resident of Bila Tserkva was found in the trunk of a Ford car driven by a citizen of Moldova. The driver tried to hide his passenger under bags and other things. As it turned out, the men were relatives: the driver, originally from Moldova, tried to help the Ukrainian escape from the country. An administrative protocol was drawn up against the Ukrainian for an attempt to illegally cross the border (Article 204-1 of the Criminal Procedure Code). The driver faces criminal liability for illegal transportation of persons across the border (Article 332 of the Criminal Code). ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: The Minister of Defense called on business to support the development of the defense complex
Description: He wrote about this on his Facebook page. Rustem Umyerov emphasized the importance of investments in the defense-industrial complex, which the Ministry of Defense Industry, the Office of the President and the government are working on jointly. The minister noted that a strategy for the development of this sector until 2025 is already being developed. One of the key topics was the reservation of personnel to replenish the ranks of the Defense Forces. According to the minister, the goal is to create a model of cooperation with business that will support both the economy and the defense of the country. The Minister of Defense also expressed gratitude to Ukrainian and international companies for their contribution to strengthening Ukraine's defense and bringing victory closer. As reported by ArmyInform, the Ministers of Defense of Ukraine and the USA discussed provision of the Armed Forces until the end of the year.

Title: The OSCE held a course for Ukrainian mine countermeasures specialists
Description: notifies the Main Directorate of Mine Action, Civil Defense and Environmental Security. The event was held with the support of the Geneva International Center for Humanitarian Demining and brought together representatives of the GU of Mine Action, Civil Defense and Environmental Security. The purpose of the course was to improve professional knowledge and skills in planning, evaluating the results of mine action activities and developing strategic planning documents. During the three-day training, the participants learned new strategies for monitoring and managing mine action activities. The deputy head of the Main Department of Mine Action, Colonel Mykhailo Kozytsky, emphasized the importance of constant improvement of the theoretical and practical skills of specialists, especially in the context of strategic planning and implementation of mine action tasks. Upon completion of the course, the trainees received certificates confirming their qualifications and readiness for further work in the field of mine countermeasures. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine was invited to become an associate member of CIOR (La Confédération interalliée des officiers de réserve) — one of the largest world organizations that unites NATO reserve officers and is affiliated with the Alliance.

Title: The Coordinating Headquarters told how the search for the fallen Defenders is going on
Description: bohdan Okhrimenko, head of the Secretariat of the Coordinating Staff for issues of treatment of prisoners of war, told about this. Search operations are conducted only in safe areas that have been previously demined and where there is no threat of hostilities or shelling. At the same time, efforts are underway to organize searches in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine. In addition, negotiations for the return of the bodies and remains of fallen Ukrainian soldiers are ongoing. The International Committee of the Red Cross regularly receives information about burial sites in the occupied territories. Citizens are urged to transmit information about the places of disappearance or burial of Ukrainian defenders through the Personal Cabinet or by telephone of the Coordination Headquarters and the Central Department of Civil-Military Cooperation of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, large-scale repatriation: Ukraine returned home 563 soldiers who died on the front line.

Title: The President of Ukraine thanked Canada for supporting NATO membership and allowing the use of long-...
Description: He wrote about this in his Telegram channel. As Volodymyr Zelenskyy reported, he expressed his gratitude to Canada for comprehensive assistance, in particular for the principled support of the Ukrainian Victory Plan. Particular attention was paid to the issue of Ukraine's membership in NATO. The President emphasized the importance of continuing Canada's efforts to advocate for the first point of this plan — Ukraine receiving an invitation to the Alliance. He urged Justin Trudeau to continue working with allies both in multilateral meetings and in direct negotiations. Volodymyr Zelenskyi also thanked Canada for its public support for the permission to use long-range weapons for military purposes on the territory of Russia. In addition, the parties coordinated positions on the eve of the G20 meeting, where, according to the president, it is important that Ukraine's position on a just and lasting peace be heard. Volodymyr Zelenskyi and Justin Trudeau also discussed Ukraine's current defense needs and agreed on further steps to continue defense cooperation between the countries. As reported by ArmyInform, Volodymyr Zelensky accepted credentials from the new ambassadors of Greece, Albania, Japan and Egypt.

Title: NATO Secretary General: Russia's cooperation with North Korea threatens not only Ukraine, but the wh...
Description: He said this during his visit to Paris. -Russia continues its offensive against Ukraine, while at the same time getting closer to its allies China, Iran and North Korea,- Mark Rutte said. He added that Russia, working together with North Korea, Iran and China, threatens not only Europe, it threatens peace and security in Europe, as well as in the Indo-Pacific region and in North America-, -That is why we must stick together - Europe , North America and our global partners — to keep our peoples safe and prosperous. And at the same time, we must keep our transatlantic alliance strong. It is obvious that the immediate task before us is to support Ukraine,- said the NATO Secretary General. Mark Rutte said that after supplying ammunition and ballistic missiles, North Korea sent its troops to fight and die alongside Russia in its illegal war against Ukraine. -In return, Russia provides North Korea with funding and missile technology. This is of great concern. These missiles pose a direct threat to the continental United States, Europe, the Indo-Pacific region and the wider Euro-Atlantic,- he said. The NATO Secretary General also reminded that Ukrainians are being killed and wounded by the deadly Shahed drones developed and supplied by Iran. With the money received from arms sales to Russia, Iran and its puppets destabilize the Middle East and finance terrorism in other regions. At the same time, China supports Russia's economy, provides its defense industry and strengthens its narrative on the world stage. As reported by ArmyInform, on November 7, President Volodymyr Zelenskyi said that the troops of North Korea u-boyah-na-kurshhyni/-> have already suffered losses in battles with the Defense Forces of Ukraine in the Kursk region of the Russian Federation.

Title: A collaborator from Vovchansk will stand trial for serving in the occupation police
Description: The Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office informed about this. It is noted that the 45-year-old local resident is accused of voluntary cooperation with the enemy. In April 2022, during the occupation of Vovchansk, the man assumed the -position of precinct commissioner- in the occupation police department controlled by the Russian administration. Before the Armed Forces of Ukraine liberated the city in September 2022, the person involved fled to the Russian Federation together with the Russian military. He is currently wanted, and he will be tried in absentia in the Chuguyiv city court. The accused faces up to 15 years in prison with confiscation of property. As reported by ArmyInform, the Kharkiv court sentenced a local resident to 10 years in prison for actively participating in spreading Kremlin narratives and justifying armed aggression of the Russian Federation.

Title: Vidar Systems has raised funds to improve the technology for detecting artillery positions
Description: This was spoke by the Deputy Prime Minister for Innovation, Education, Science and Technology, Minister of Digital Transformation of Ukraine Mykhailo Fedorov. Funds came from angel investors and the Czech venture fund Presto Ventures. The investment was received thanks to the company's participation in the Brave1 initiative, which constantly presents Ukrainian defense tech companies to investors. An introduction to the Presto Ventures fund took place at the Invest Demo Day organized by Brave1. Funds raised will be used to expand the team and scale the product to improve its effectiveness in combat environments. Mykhailo Fedorov emphasized the importance of the development of the Ukrainian defense tech sector and noted that such investments are proof of the rapid development of this direction in Ukraine. Brave1 continues to support startups in the defense sector, helping them find investors and receive funding to implement innovative solutions. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine became one from the world capitals in the field of drone technology and now offers its experience to Europe as a foundation for European security.

Title: The Ministers of Defense of Ukraine and the United States discussed the provision of the Armed Force...
Description: He wrote about this on his Facebook page. Rustem Umyerov informed his American colleague about the course of hostilities and the urgent needs of the Ukrainian military. The parties discussed measures to provide Ukrainian soldiers with everything they need until the end of the year. The Minister of Defense expressed gratitude to the United States for its constant support and strong partnership, emphasizing the importance of further cooperation to strengthen Ukraine's defense capabilities in the face of war with Russia. As reported by ArmyInform, the change of service location: Rustem Umyerov explained how the new mechanism will work.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyi accepted credentials from the new ambassadors of Greece, Albania, Japan and Egyp...
Description: About informs the Office of the President of Ukraine. The head of state congratulated them on the start of the diplomatic mission in Ukraine and expressed hope for strengthening cooperation between the countries. During the meeting with the Ambassador of Greece, Volodymyr Zelensky noted the high level of bilateral relations and thanked for the defense support. The President talked about the main needs for military aid, primarily in air defense equipment, artillery and armored vehicles, and also emphasized the importance of the practical implementation of reconstruction projects by Greece. -We have very good relations between the countries. Cooperation between our nations is very important to us. I know that your colleagues visited Odesa with an initiative to restore it. Maybe Greece will be able to join other countries and take one of the regions under its patronage,- the head of state said. In a conversation with the Ambassador of Albania, Volodymyr Zelensky noted the opening of the Albanian Embassy in Ukraine, which was evidence of the dynamic development of bilateral relations. The head of state thanked the government and people of Albania for their constant support since the beginning of the full-scale Russian invasion. Separately, he emphasized the importance of signing a bilateral security agreement as soon as possible. -We have had consultations on a bilateral security agreement. We hope that with your help we will prepare the document for signing as soon as possible,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. During the meeting with the Ambassador of Japan, the President noted his country's support for Ukraine and the development of current bilateral cooperation, expressed readiness for further intensification of dialogue at all levels, and also discussed current security challenges for Ukraine. The head of state emphasized that it is important to strengthen cooperation with Japan in the security sphere regarding the exchange of information and ways of joint response to the participation of the North Korean military in the war against Ukraine. -Strong positions have been built between our countries. Our countries have signed an important and strong document on security guarantees. Today, the situation with North Korea and its troops on the Russian side requires a reaction - we need Japan's support,- noted Volodymyr Zelenskyy. In a conversation with the Ambassador of Egypt, the President noted that Ukraine is interested in intensifying bilateral dialogue, quickly restoring trade and economic cooperation, as well as implementing specific projects in the field of food security. The head of state also emphasized that it is important to involve Egypt in promoting the Peace Formula, including joining the Joint Communiqué. -I hope, Mr. Ambassador, during your term of office, our relations with Egypt will become stronger. We had a good trade before the war: mostly agricultural products. We now have defensive training and are ready to develop in this direction. We have a food security initiative -Grain from Ukraine-, and we hope that Egypt will join this mission,- Volodymyr Zelenskyi said. As reported by ArmyInform, the President spoke about the new system of military transfers without delays and bureaucracy.

Title: He hoped for his brother and got lost in the forest: the unfortunate laborer never reached Poland
Description: About this informs State Border Service of Ukraine. The incident happened in the border area when a man, trying to get to Poland, lost his orientation and could not find his way for more than a day. According to the DPSU, the man was planning a trip together with his brother, who works in Poland, and offered him a job in Warsaw. However, having no experience in moving through the forest, he quickly lost his way after leaving the car and heading for Slovakia. The border squad of the -Princess- branch found the man in the forest, where he was trying to find his way. The detainee was in satisfactory condition and did not require medical assistance. The man was taken to the border unit, where he will be prosecuted for attempting to cross the border illegally. For violation of part 1 of Art. 204-1 of the Code of Administrative Offenses -Illegal crossing or attempted illegal crossing of the state border of Ukraine- the court will determine the degree of punishment. ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: The President talked about the new system of military transfers without delays and bureaucracy
Description: The head of state told about this during the evening address. In particular, the Cabinet of Ministers adopted a resolution that provides introduction of a painless transfer process through the Army+ platform. In his address, Volodymyr Zelenskyy emphasized that the technical functionality is already ready, and the Ministry of Defense will determine how the system will be launched. An important condition is the minimization of bureaucracy - all reports of servicemen must receive clear answers. In addition, all commanders' decisions regarding reports will be carefully monitored to avoid unjustified rejections. The President also noted that the system will operate in a test mode at the first stage, and the details of this process will be clarified by the Ministry of Defense. He expressed his gratitude to everyone involved in the development of the new feature. Volodymyr Zelenskyi also instructed the Ministry of Defense and the General Staff to expand this opportunity to all Defense and Security Forces, including the National Guard and the Border Service. The president emphasized that all soldiers deserve equal respect. As reported by ArmyInform, the change of service location: Rustem Umyerov explained how the new mechanism will work.

Title: The border guards showed the last moments of the Russian armored personnel carrier before its comple...
Description: This was reported by State Border Service of Ukraine. As noted, Ukrainian border guards continue to play an important role in the defense of the country, actively participating in combat operations on the front line. They carry out defensive operations and strike at the enemy in coordination with other units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. In destruction of the enemy BTR-70, the border guards demonstrated high efficiency and accuracy, which allows them to deter the attacks of Russian troops on key directions. The successful actions of the border guards help ensure the security of the Ukrainian border and contribute to the overall success of the country's defense against the aggressor. As reported by ArmyInform, invaders continue to storm the positions of Ukrainian defenders. In total, 110 combat clashes have already taken place since the beginning of the day. Most of the battles were recorded in the Kurakhiv and Pokrovsky directions.

Title: The command of the Ground Forces will conduct an additional check on the interference of a civilian ...
Description: The Land Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine inform about this. The Command of the Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, having studied in detail the conclusions of the Main Directorate of the Military Law and Order Service of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, and taking into account their proposals, began an additional examination of the circumstances of the incident between the civil servant O.V. Dmitriev. and military personnel of the Asgard group. Unbiased measures of additional verification were simultaneously initiated in relation to all participants in the incident. In particular, in accordance with Part 1 of Article 68 of the Law of Ukraine -On Civil Service-, a disciplinary proceeding was opened and a disciplinary commission was established in relation to O. V. Dmitriev. At the same time, on the basis of paragraph 15, point 1 of Chapter II of the Procedure for conducting an official investigation in the Armed Forces of Ukraine, approved by the order of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine dated 21.11.2017 No. 608, an official investigation was launched with the aim of clarifying the reasons and conditions that contributed to the offense and establishing the degree of guilt of servicemen. Information on the results will be provided additionally. -We ask the public, until the results of the additional inspection are made public, to refrain from premature conclusions regarding the incident between a civil servant and military personnel from the Asgard group,- the department emphasized. As ArmyInform reported, the Commander of the Ground Forces reacted to the incident regarding the interference of a civilian in the work of the -Asgard- unit.

Title: Nikopol region is under fire: the Rosarmy attacked the district -Grada- and drones
Description: informed the head of the Dnipropetrovsk regional military administration Serhiy Lysak. As a result of shelling, infrastructure, an industrial enterprise, as well as 8 private houses, 5 farm buildings, a garage and a car were damaged. Gas burners and power lines were damaged. Fortunately, no one was hurt. We will remind you that in Kryvyi Rih from the ruins of the house affected by the Russians, the bodies of three children and their mother were unblocked. As reported by ArmyInform, a series of shelling in Kherson Oblast: Russian troops wounded ten civilians.

Title: Nicholas Karma in the forest near the border: how much does Look cost military
Description: About this informs State Border Service of Ukraine. Border guard Nazar said that his uniform is a state provision, because military personnel are fully supported by the state. The price of purchasing clothes for the military is about five thousand hryvnias. Baghlat about 3 thousand hryvnias, a field suit about 1,500 hryvnias and a hat over 100 hryvnias. The border guard is a canine specialist, so they work as a couple both on duty and in life. Cora the dog is trained to search for explosives and weapons. By the way, in her three years of service, Cora has many cases of detection of prohibited items in her -work-in-progress-. As reported by ArmyInform, The Ministry of Defense invites manufacturers to a meeting on the development and improvement of tangible property for the Armed Forces.

Title: The Secretary General of NATO and the President of France discussed increasing support to Ukraine ah...
Description: This was reported by site of the Alliance. NATO noted that Ukraine may face the harshest winter, as Russia relentlessly attacks its energy infrastructure. Mark Rutte thanked France for training and equipping the Ukrainian brigade of Anne of Kyiv, as well as for the promise to send Mirage fighter jets early next year. -France provided modern artillery guns, air defense systems, cruise missiles and armored vehicles,- he said. The Secretary General also expressed concern about the deepening military ties between Russia, China, Iran and North Korea, which pose a threat to European security and global peace. As ArmiyaInform reported, on the sidelines of the summit in Budapest on November 7, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi held a meeting with -oboronnu-pidtrymku-ukrayiny/->President of France Emmanuel Macron and NATO General Secretary Mark Rutte

Title: Murder of a military man in Kyiv: the culprit was sentenced to 13 years behind bars
Description: This is reported by the Office of the Prosecutor General. In support of the public prosecution, the prosecutors of the Holosiiv District Prosecutor's Office found the man guilty of intentional murder and sentenced him to 13 years in prison (Part 2, Article 115 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). Two other participants in the incident were found guilty of hooliganism and were sentenced to 3 years in prison each. The incident occurred on October 21, 2022, on Akademik Hlushkov Avenue, when a dispute arose between the driver of a Hyundai (military) car and a Lexus driver regarding the right of way. During the conflict, Lexus passengers beat the Hyundai driver, and his driver shot a soldier. The victim died on the spot from his injuries, and the perpetrators left the scene. As reported by ArmyInform, Kharkiv paliya of the cars of Ukrainian defenders was detained.

Title: A series of shelling in the Kherson region: Russian troops injured ten civilians
Description: This was reported by the Kherson Regional Military Administration. According to preliminary data, a 54-year-old woman suffered an explosive injury, a head injury and a leg injury. An 86-year-old woman received an explosive injury and brain contusion. Both victims were hospitalized for medical treatment. Three more people, including two men aged 31 and 62, were also injured by enemy fire. The 31-year-old woman suffered blast injuries, lacerations and broken legs, while the men suffered blast injuries and contusions. All victims are under medical supervision. In addition, at 11:00 a.m. on the same day, Russian troops attacked Havrylivka with the help of unmanned aerial vehicles. The 77-year-old man received a blast injury, shrapnel wounds to the chest, arms and face, as well as a concussion. The victim was hospitalized. A similar attack took place in Stanislav, where a 70-year-old man was injured during enemy fire. He suffered blast injury, contusion and shrapnel wounds to his head, chest, arms and legs. He is currently in hospital. It also became known about one more victim due to the impact of a Russian UAV. A 44-year-old man, who was at the bus stop at the time of the attack, received a blast injury and shrapnel wounds to his leg. Also, around 3:00 p.m., Russian troops shelled Veletenske, as a result of which a 37-year-old man received an explosive injury, a contusion, and a fragmentary forehead wound. He was admitted to the hospital. In Bilozerka, as a result of enemy fire on November 10, a 72-year-old woman who was on the street was injured. She suffered a blast injury, a concussion and a concussion and was hospitalized. In total, nine victims are known at this time. They are given the necessary medical care. As reported by ArmyInform, in the Kherson region during the past day due to Russian aggression two people died and one more was injured.

Title: Damage to the dam of the Kurakhiv Reservoir: Donetsk OVA spoke about the consequences
Description: reported this by the head of the Donetsk Regional State Administration, Vadym Filashkin. As of 16:00 on November 12, 15 million cubic meters of water spilled from the Kurakhiv Reservoir. -Fortunately, the villages on the Vovchii River were not flooded. We continue to monitor the situation. In case of significant changes, I will notify you additionally,- the message reads. As reported by ArmiyaInform, on November 11, occupying Russian troops damaged the dam of the Kurakhiv reservoir . After that, the water level in the river within the Velikonovosilkiv community rose by 1.2 meters. November 12 in the Kurakhiv direction invaders attacked 41 times near Illinka, Novoselidivka, Voznesenka, Novodmytrivka, Dalnyi and Antonivka. 17 attempts by the occupiers to advance have already been repulsed. The fighting continues, the hottest at the moment near Illinka and Novoselydivka. Enemy aviation struck Kurakhovo, Dalny and Andriivka, dropping ten air defense systems.

Title: Kyiv, Khmelnytskyi, Cherkasy region: accomplices of the Russian Federation who justified the war aga...
Description: The SBU reported this. A former foreign language teacher who called for support for Putin and the takeover of Ukraine on social networks was exposed in Kyiv. A 36-year-old immigrant from Zaporizhzhia was also detained in the capital, who was -streaming- the geolocation of the Ukrainian military, in particular mobile groups of the TCC, to thematic telegram channels. In Cherkasy region, four administrators of anonymous groups were exposed in messengers, who notified evaders about the addresses of roadblocks and gave advice on how to avoid conscription. An immigrant from Donetsk region was detained in Khmelnytskyi, who justified the missile strike by the Rashists on the Okhmatdyt Children's Hospital on the air of a chat-roulette. On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service notified the detainees of suspicion (in accordance with the crimes committed) under the following articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: Part 1 of Art. 114-1 (obstructing the legal activities of the Armed Forces and other military formations during a special period); Part 1 of Art. 436-2 (justification, recognition as legitimate, denial of armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, glorification of its participants). They face prison sentences. As ArmiyaInform reported, a local propagandist was sentenced to 10 years in prison in Kharkiv.

Title: the Russians were destroyed at the crossing, assaults in the Kurakhiv direction: a stream from the f...
Description: They fought back with drones, artillery and the Leopard tank. The result: 29 eliminated Russians, 19 wounded, two destroyed tanks and six BBM. The Russians are trying to counterattack in Kurshchyna as well. 225 OSHB and other brigades of the Defense Forces are doing well and restraining the enemy. As in 2022, the Russians are storming in columns on the same road, which has already been well shot by our fighters. Armored vehicles burn right on the road, and drones and mortars destroy the Russians who have scattered around the village. -Wild Hornets- are testing and improving the STING interceptor drone. This drone is supposed to intercept -Shakhedi-. Video of the manufacturing and testing process - watch in the stream. These and other topics are discussed by our presenters - lieutenant colonel Serhiy Misyura and captain Artem Golub.

Title: The Ministry of Defense returned 350 hectares of land in six regions of Ukraine
Description: About this informs the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. These lands are located in the Ternopil, Vinnytsia, Mykolaiv, Kyiv, Odesa and Kirovohrad regions. During the past years, they were illegally removed from the sphere of management of the Ministry of Defense. Now they will be used to strengthen Ukraine's defense capabilities. -In the conditions of a full-scale invasion of Russia, every hectare of defense land must be used for its intended purpose. Alienation of critically important territories is unacceptable. This is a matter of national security, so we should cooperate with the State Geocadaster in a coordinated manner,- said Deputy Defense Minister of Ukraine Dmytro Klimenkov. In order to prevent new cases of illegal alienation of land, during 2023-2024, the Ministry of Defense together with the State Geocadastre conducted a state inventory and registered 84 land plots in the State Land Cadastre. The total area of ​​these territories reaches 7,000 hectares. In addition, the Ministry of Defense with the assistance of the State Geocadastre during 2023-2024 conducted an inventory and registered 223 land plots with a total area of ​​15,000 hectares in the State Land Cadastre. It is planned to register another 4,500 hectares by the end of the year. The Ministry of Defense together with the State Geocadastre plan to continue to take all necessary measures to restore the state's right to defense land. As reported by ArmyInform, The Ministry of Defense returned a property complex and a plot of land in Kyiv worth UAH 300 million.

Title: Change of place of service: Rustem Umyerov explained how the new mechanism will work
Description: This was announced by the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov. -Instead of long approvals, now only a copy of the military ticket (or officer's ID) and a letter of recommendation from the new brigade are required. For private and non-commissioned officers, permission from the acting commander is no longer required,- the minister explained. The personnel center of the Armed Forces processes documents according to a clearly defined procedure within 72 hours. If there are no reasons for refusal, the serviceman receives a notification about the result of the review in the Army+ application. And in the case of a negative decision, a notification of the reasons for refusal. Protection of military rights is also provided for: the Ministry of Defense will review unjustified refusals. Transfer is possible no more than once a year, and after 6 months of service in the current unit. The initiative was developed by the Ministry of Defense together with the Armed Forces and public organizations. -This decision is an opportunity for every soldier to more effectively use his experience and skills where they are most needed,- Rustem Umyerov emphasized. As reported by ArmiyaInform, the Government adopted a resolution that introduces a real and transparent transfer mechanism for soldiers between military units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The new procedure is planned to be launched on November 15.

Title: The invaders stepped up their attacks: 110 combat clashes per day, the hottest in two directions
Description: informs the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine about this. Today, the communities of Pavlivka, Zhuravka, Volfine, Vysoke, Basivka, Novenke, Bachivsk, Budky, Khrinivka, Timofiivka, Studenok, and Vodolagi were affected by enemy artillery and mortar fire in Kharkiv Oblast, Chernihiv Oblast, and Sumy Oblast. Basivka and Yunakivka were hit by airstrikes of the terrorist army. In the Kharkiv direction the enemy stormed the positions of our units four times. There is a battle going on in the Vovchanska region. The enemy also carried out airstrikes by air defense systems on Liptsi and Vilchi region. In the Kupyansk direction, since the beginning of the century, the Russian occupiers have been conducting offensive operations near Kolisnykyvka, Zagryzovy, Kruglyakivka, and Lozova. Five skirmishes are ongoing. In the Lyman direction the enemy attacked twice near Novomykhailivka and Torsky. Conducted airstrikes on Thorny. In the Toretsk direction, the occupiers, with the support of bomber aircraft, tried five times to dislodge our units from their positions in the Toretsk and Shcherbinivka districts, and the battle is currently ongoing.
